review:
The Culling of The Cows Ã© um tower defense com uma temÃ¡tica bem humorada e peculiar. Nele, vocÃª assume o papel de um fazendeiro rabugento que se vÃª enfrentando uma invasÃ£o de ovnis nazistas que estÃ£o abduzindo seu gado e habitantes para dominar o mundo. A histÃ³ria se desenrola com um caipira determinado a salvar sua esposa e impedir a catÃ¡strofe.

O jogo oferece uma experiÃªncia divertida e desafiadora, combinando mecÃ¢nicas de tower defense com elementos de jogos de tiro em plataforma. No entanto, alguns problemas afetam a jogabilidade, como a inconsistÃªncia na hitbox dos gados, o que pode resultar em frustraÃ§Ã£o quando os tiros atravessam os inimigos sem causar dano.

Outro aspecto a ser considerado sÃ£o os drops aleatÃ³rios de recursos, que podem ser obtidos atravÃ©s de quedas aÃ©reas. Isso adiciona um elemento de sorte ao jogo, o que nem sempre Ã© bem recebido pela comunidade de jogadores.

No geral, com alguns ajustes, o jogo poderia ser ainda mais envolvente e divertido. Ainda assim, Ã© uma boa opÃ§Ã£o para os fÃ£s de jogos de tiro em plataforma e tower defense.

author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3874, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 479, 'last_played': 1665081641}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right handâ€”the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bedâ€”the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198151293050', 'num_games_owned': 48, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1627851560}
review:
"The Culling of the Cows" ist ein ungewÃ¶hnliches Indie-Spiel, das von Decaying Logic entwickelt wurde. Es wurde erstmals 2014 verÃ¶ffentlicht und bietet einen einzigartigen Ansatz fÃ¼r das Tower-Defense-Genre. Hier ist eine ausfÃ¼hrliche Rezension des Spiels:

[b]1. Gameplay: 7/10 - Originelle Mischung aus Genres[/b]

Das Gameplay von "The Culling of the Cows" ist eine eigenwillige Kombination aus Tower Defense und Action-Elementen. Der Spieler Ã¼bernimmt die Kontrolle Ã¼ber einen Bauern, der seine Farm vor anrÃ¼ckenden Horden von KÃ¼hen schÃ¼tzen muss. Die originelle Idee, KÃ¼he als Gegner zu verwenden, verleiht dem Spiel einen einzigartigen Charme. Die Herausforderung besteht darin, taktisch platzierte Verteidigungsanlagen zu nutzen und gleichzeitig in Echtzeit gegen die angreifenden KÃ¼he zu kÃ¤mpfen. Allerdings kann die Wiederholbarkeit des Spielkonzepts auf lange Sicht begrenzt sein.

[b]2. Grafik und Design: 6/10 - Einfache, aber effektive PrÃ¤sentation[/b]

Die Grafik von "The Culling of the Cows" ist einfach gehalten, aber sie erfÃ¼llt ihren Zweck. Die Umgebungen sind klar und gut erkennbar, und der Cartoonstil passt gut zum humorvollen Ansatz des Spiels. Obwohl die Grafiken nicht besonders anspruchsvoll sind, tragen sie dennoch zur humorvollen AtmosphÃ¤re bei.

[b]3. Sound und Musik: 5/10 - Durchschnittliche AudiounterstÃ¼tzung[/b]

Die Musik und Soundeffekte in "The Culling of the Cows" sind durchschnittlich. Die Hintergrundmusik passt gut zum Spielthema, aber sie ist nicht besonders einprÃ¤gsam. Die Soundeffekte sind funktional, kÃ¶nnten jedoch mehr Vielfalt bieten, um das Spielerlebnis aufzuwerten.

[b]4. Einzelspielermodus: 6/10 - Solider SpielspaÃŸ fÃ¼r Zwischendurch[/b]

Das Spiel konzentriert sich auf den Einzelspielermodus, und obwohl es einen soliden SpielspaÃŸ fÃ¼r kurze Spielsessions bietet, kann die Langzeitmotivation begrenzt sein. Der Witz und die OriginalitÃ¤t des Spielkonzepts tragen dazu bei, dass es eine unterhaltsame Erfahrung ist, aber es fehlt vielleicht an der Tiefe und Vielfalt, um dauerhaft zu fesseln.

[b]5. Technische Aspekte: 7/10 - Stabile Performance[/b]

In Bezug auf die technische Umsetzung bietet "The Culling of the Cows" eine stabile Performance. Es lÃ¤uft auf verschiedenen Systemen stabil, und wÃ¤hrend meines Tests traten keine grÃ¶ÃŸeren technischen Probleme oder Bugs auf. Die Steuerung ist einfach und gut umgesetzt.

[b]6. Wiederspielbarkeit und Langzeitmotivation: 5/10 - Begrenzte Langzeitmotivation[/b]

Die Wiederspielbarkeit des Spiels kÃ¶nnte begrenzt sein, da das Grundkonzept nach einiger Zeit repetitiv werden kann. Obwohl es Herausforderungen und verschiedene Level gibt, kÃ¶nnte es an zusÃ¤tzlichen Elementen fehlen, um die Spieler fÃ¼r lÃ¤ngere Zeit zu fesseln.

[b]7. Community und Support: 6/10 - Engagierte Entwickler[/b]

Die Community rund um das Spiel mag nicht besonders groÃŸ sein, aber die Entwickler zeigen sich engagiert. RegelmÃ¤ÃŸige Updates und die Bereitschaft, auf das Feedback der Spieler einzugehen, zeugen von einer positiven Einstellung gegenÃ¼ber der Spielergemeinschaft.

[b]Fazit: 6/10 - Kurzweiliger SpaÃŸ mit begrenzter Tiefe[/b]

"The Culling of the Cows" ist ein kurzweiliges Spiel, das mit seiner originellen Idee und humorvollen PrÃ¤sentation punktet. Es bietet einen unterhaltsamen Zeitvertreib fÃ¼r kurze Spielsessions, allerdings kÃ¶nnte es an Tiefe und Langzeitmotivation fehlen, um langfristig zu fesseln. FÃ¼r Spieler, die nach einem originellen Twist im Tower-Defense-Genre suchen, kann es jedoch eine interessante Wahl sein.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049823783', 'num_games_owned': 1712, 'num_reviews': 1265, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1695342828}
review:
Es un Shooter en 2D bizarro, estilo TD en el sentido de que los enemigos no tienen que entrar al granero porque te saca vidas y al matarlos todos ganas (cuando terminan las oleadas) Podes estar abajo caminando (y agarrando cajas y dinero) o fijo estacionario arriba disparando con alguna escopeta o metralleta
Caen del cielo cada tanto Cajas con algÃºn poder random (ej. balas infinitas, explosivas, hacer los enemigos mas lentos, etc.)
Tenes tambiÃ©n fijos por nivel Poderes de Ayuda (Ametralladoras, bombas, sierra en la puerta, fuego que cae del cielo y quema unidades, etc.) todos estos son poderes que tienen un tiempo muerto relativamente corto para volver a usarlos, pero es infinito.
En cada â€œescenarioâ€ (cambia la escenografÃ­a pero tiene el mismo formato) Hay Oleadas (distintos bichos) teniendo cada bicho sus propias caracterÃ­sticas ej. mas lentos, mas rapidos, voladores, explosivos, saltarines, etc. 
Finalizas la batalla contra un OVNI Aleman Nazi re bizarro y ganas.
El juego esta muy bueno, sonidos copados, musica, jugabilidad, duracion, tiene logros, Cloud y CROMOS que le mejoran mucho el valor al titulo.

Es una pena que no tenga workshop, ya que agregaria muchisima rejugabilidad, tanto de oleadas, como de Bosses y nuevos enemigos. Lo otro que es un pecado es que la musica este vendida por separado

8/10 - Si te gusta el genero es un Must play sin dudas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027782034', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 461, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 461, 'last_played': 1698141899}
review: An arcade-style shooter game that evokes something of the energy that the original Postal did, but 15 years too late. The core game play loop is tight, but there are issues with the perspective line of fire, with projectiles frequently sailing past enemies that should have taken the hit. There are similar shortcomings in some levels like a late-game onslaught level where you're given a rapid-fire rocket launcher where the projectiles sail off the edge of the screen rather than hitting the ground. There is a little bit of splash damage like you might expect, but the projectiles can only ever contact enemies and not the environment, making the splash damage a bit perfunctory. The controls are a struggle, with a keyboard-dominant control scheme that derides the player for trying to use a controller (the scheme for which is not fully implemented). Ultimately, CotC is not a bad game, but it's old-soul energy spoils a lot of the fun that could otherwise have been had with it. The game might be good for a giggle if you got it as part of a bundle, but I can't recommend an outright purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037295108', 'num_games_owned': 1249, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1689297242}
review: Y'all listen up now! "The Culling Of The Cows" is one heck of a game! It's a wild 2D shooter with some fancy side-scrollin' fights. Ya take on the role of an old, wise farmer protectin' his precious barn from them Zombie Cows and any other critters tryin' to bust through. Lucky for ya, ya got yerself a kickass gun that ya can upgrade over time, along with some mighty special goodies and a supply pack to help ya stomp them Zombie Cows flat. And believe it or not, there's even a bad-to-the-bone Nazi Ufo to reckon with!

author: {'steamid': '76561198121771843', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1683453936}

author: {'steamid': '76561198037345945', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1676098786}
review:
This game was really enjoyable to play and complete 100%. It took me around 3 hours to get all the achievements. Be prepared to use your memory and pattern recognition skills to succeed. Overall, it's a quick and fun game to play for a night of gaming.

If you're interested in getting this game, I recommend waiting for a discount or trying to find a free copy or code like I did. If it's priced around $1-2, it's definitely worth considering.

author: {'steamid': '76561198343525179', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1686534767}

Uma das forÃ§as de The Culling Of The Cows Ã© sua acessibilidade. Os controles sÃ£o diretos, permitindo que jogadores de todos os nÃ­veis de habilidade entrem e comecem a jogar rapidamente. A mecÃ¢nica do jogo Ã© fÃ¡cil de entender, tornando-o adequado para jogadores casuais ou aqueles que procuram uma experiÃªncia de jogo rÃ¡pida e agradÃ¡vel.

No entanto, como qualquer jogo, The Culling Of The Cows tem seus pontos fracos. Em conclusÃ£o, The Culling Of The Cows Ã© um bom jogo de arcade que oferece uma jogabilidade simples e agradÃ¡vel. author: {'steamid': '76561198059825119', 'num_games_owned': 219, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1684240630}
review:
Simple, humoristic and most importantly entertaining base defence game. 
You must defend your farm from variouos types of zombies, infected cows and a final alien boss. 
This game is very rough around the edges, don't expect something of a high quality. 
In the beginning it seems hard, hectic and frustrating, but when you get the hand of it it's a good few hours of fun. 
It's all about realizing which upgrades to buy and which to ignore. 
For some reason it wasn't possible to take screenshots. 
Buy if you like base defence games.

author: {'steamid': '76561199282833173', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1679480919}
review:
Not the type of tower defense game i'm hopping for, it not fun at all. Again, steam user review can't be trusted!!

I start dying on stage 2 (after the tutorial) then it got worst on stage 3 and even worst on stage 4, i can't remember the times i'm death!!! WTH

Out of 10 shots, you will mostly miss 1 or 2 shots, the alignment is terrible, but the mobs have no issue attacking you even its not alight with it.

It is not fun keep pressing the "R" key for reload, and the reload is damn slow! Its really sux!

Since it only cost ARS$ 6,79 (USD 0.033) and it comes with a free (aka. useless) DLC for Pixel Puzzles Ultimate Jigsaw - T.C.O.T.C , i guess i just keep it and not refunding it, but still I don't recommended even at this price -90%.

author: {'steamid': '76561198987204504', 'num_games_owned': 436, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1676066216}
review:
The Culling Of The Cows ist ein groÃŸartiges Aktions- und Strategiespiel, das Spieler in den Bann zieht. Das Indie-Spiel wurde von Pixel Puzzles entwickelt und verÃ¶ffentlicht und ist Teil der gleichnamigen Franchise. Seit seiner VerÃ¶ffentlichung im Mai 2014 hat es sich einen Namen gemacht und begeistert Spieler weltweit.

Das Spiel bietet eine hervorragende Kombination aus strategischem Denken und schnellem Handeln, was es zu einem einzigartigen Erlebnis macht. Die Grafik ist atemberaubend und die Soundeffekte sind einfach fantastisch.

Ich wÃ¼rde das Spiel jedem empfehlen, der nach einem Herausforderung sucht und eine Menge SpaÃŸ haben mÃ¶chte. Mit einer Bewertung von 8/10 bei GAMERamble, kann ich sagen, dass The Culling Of The Cows definitiv einen Platz auf Ihrer Spieleliste verdient hat.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979961681', 'num_games_owned': 1195, 'num_reviews': 227, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1673928039}
review:
[h1]SUMMARY[/h1]
Gory wave-shooter not quite up to snuff.

The comedic underpinnings are there; a farmer forced to defend his farm from zombie cows instead of the usual zombified humans. There are even some variations in the gameplay where you fight bosses, and also shoot from a fixed position, while the main game mode offers supply drops, alternate ammo types, and upgrade paths. Ultimately it just feels...kind of meh.

The animations are okay, the art style is appropriately goofy-yet-gritty, and it has entertaining death scenes for each enemy type, showing a certain level of polish that you don't typically see here. And yet, it ultimately fails to produce a compelling push to get you to finish it.

[h1]OVERALL SCORE[/h1]
Somewhat Not Recommended

[h1]REPLAY VALUE[/h1]
Above Average

author: {'steamid': '76561198091808820', 'num_games_owned': 1159, 'num_reviews': 197, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1660614439}
review:
it doesn't take much for a game like this to be good fun on a sunday afternoon.
but this one fails horribly. no cardinal sin in the book has been left out. gotta commit them all!

there is one weapon and one weapon only. 
you can't move and shoot / reload at the same time.
you will wear out your R key even more because you need to reload every single shell individually. there are upgrades for that later though. still a pain in the #ss.
hitboxes are messed up and so is the background / foreground logic. sometimes you can't hit enemies right in front of you with your shotgun but they can touch and kill you no problem. you always need to look at the enemies' feet like some sort of fetish boy to hit them properly.

after 2 minutes i got sick and tired of this game already but i kept going for the 100% and it took me 2.5 hours to get it all done.

a complete no fun zone and a waste of a perfectly fine evening.
i would not play this game again even if it was the last game on earth.
any free browser game from 20 years ago is better than this.
also you need like 4 hands to manage movement, combat, upgrades and power ups.
a terrible experience from start to finish.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017903948', 'num_games_owned': 1907, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1263, 'last_played': 1669417340}
review: I am a 48 year old father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my son, who is now 15. My son downloaded The Culling Of The Cows and in less than a week, he had already played for over 20 hours. This was terrible for me, as it was already hard enough for me to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching videos on Tiktok. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, did the tutorial but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought my son and I closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971838196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 356, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1663087518}
review:
Spielwertung: 6/10
Spielzeit: ca. 3 Stunden
SpieldurchlÃ¤ufe: 1 (Ende)

Schnell, klobig, unfertig, aber dennoch fÃ¼r einen einzigen Run spaÃŸig und wohlwollend aufgenommen

+ Graphik: Sehr hÃ¼bsch
+ 5 Erfolge, die man nebenbei sammeln kann

+/- 3 "unterschiedliche" Levelmodi, aber seid nicht zu aufgeregt. Die meisten Level sind "Waves". Dann gibt es noch "kill all" (in einem Rutsch) und "Onslaught", wo man endlos Munition hat und quasi ScharfschÃ¼tze spielt, aber keinerlei Boni/Skills/Drops etc. besitzt. Gerade Letzterer ist UNGLAUBLICH LANGWEILIG. Alles, was man macht, ist Maus1 zu halten und minimal zu bewegen, ohne Unterbrechung. 
+/- Story/Humor/Snippets: Im Grunde existiert das alles nicht, muss ja auch nicht bei einem solchen Genre, aber hier und da muss man mal grinsen oder horcht kurz auf. 
+/- Upgrades/Waffen: Ja, es ist schÃ¶n, eine Wahl zu haben. Leider lÃ¤uft es in jedem Map auf dieselbe Wahl raus (Standardwaffe meh, Penetration nutzlos, also, je nach Gusto, immer 6 oder 8, ich habe durchweg 6 genommen. Bei den Upgrades dasselbe: Munition, wichtig, Nachladen, superwichtig, Schussrate nice, aber Bonus, Laser vÃ¶llig nutzlos. 
+/- Die Skills sind teilweise massiv unterschiedlich vom Nutzen her, aber sobald man sich etwas dran gewÃ¶hnt hat, kann man gut rotieren. Die Sache ist die: Einerseits kann man am Ende die Skills fast durchweg anhaben, wobei einer schon reicht, um alles dichtzumachen, andererseits kann man auch "nur" mit der Waffe alles regeln, sobald man wenigstens die meisten Upgrades gekauft hat. Die Skills sind teilweise so sehr Ablenkung, dass man eher "versagt", als wenn man sich "nur" aufs SchieÃŸen konzentriert.
+/- Der Sinn der Karte: Es gibt mehrere Wege, die zum selben "Endziel" fÃ¼hren. Es gibt aber weder einen Grund die Level zu farmen fÃ¼r Erfolge noch fÃ¼r SpielÃ¶konomie. Was also soll das? Ich habe zwar alle Level gespielt, aber der Sinn ist mir schleierhaft, warum sich vieles einfach "verdoppelt".
+/- Der Sinn der "Herausforderungen". Jedes Level (zumindest alle "Waves") hat zusÃ¤tzlich 3 "Challenges". Diese einfach zu ignorieren ist aber der beste Ratschlag, denn wenn man sie "befolgt" wird das Spiel nur schwerer, aber sonst bringt einem das nichts. Vielleicht schaltet man damit ja irgendetwas frei, vielleicht die Extras? Die Sache ist nur die, dass durch die Herausforderungen das Spiel nicht mehr, sondern weniger SpaÃŸ macht, weil es einem stÃ¤ndig zwingt Dinge "nicht" zu tun (Skills, Upgrades) oder zu schaffen (keinen Schuss verfehlen, was fast unmÃ¶glich ist).

- Der Sound (wahnsinnig monoton/nervend, gerade bei "Onslaught", lieber maximal runterpegeln)
- Die "Drops": Das einzig NÃ¼tzliche ist GELD. Alles andere ist Quatsch. Wie kÃ¶nnen diese Drops denn manchmal bis in die Mitte fliegen? Dort rauszugehen ist meistens Selbstmord, vor allem, weil kein einziger Nicht-Geld-Drop es wert ist. KEINER. Vor allem "Unsterblichkeit" ist vÃ¶llig schlecht designed. Man sollte wenigstens einen Timer oder einen Sound-Q haben, wann das Ding ablÃ¤uft. 
- Movement: Der Alte bewegt sich furchtbar, deswegen auch hÃ¤ufig unnÃ¶tige Tode. Selbst mit dem Drop "Speed" ist das schaurig. Im Grunde tut man gut daran sich aufs SchieÃŸen zu konzentrieren, um nie etwas in die NÃ¤he kommen zu lassen. 
- Im MenÃ¼ unter "Extras" findet sich: Nichts.
- Die Spielzeit von 3 Stunden (ohne zusÃ¤tzliche Routen eher 2 Stunden oder weniger): FÃ¼r 3.99 finde ich das zu wenig, andererseits gibts das Spiel sicher im Sale oder in Bundles fÃ¼r unter 1 â‚¬, dafÃ¼r ist es auf jeden Fall in Ordnung. 

Fazit: FÃ¼r einmaliges Zombie-Gemetzel anstÃ¤ndig, danach darf es aber auch gerne wieder fÃ¼r immer vergessen werden. Ich hatte mit dem gleichnamigen Puzzle von Pixel Puzzles mehr SpaÃŸ, aber hey ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198194961654', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1626071247}
review:
I personally find this to be a take-it-or-leave-it type of game you might stumble upon in an arcade, but it's not something worth paying for. You stand there while obnoxious alien/zombie bulls and undead humans race towards you in an attempt to infiltrate your barn... for some reason? The music is obnoxious, the sound effects are obnoxious, and the hit-boxes are especially obnoxious. 

It's also obnoxiously fun though, if you're in the mood for an old fashioned arcade style shooting platform. I'll pick it up for some mindless fun while waiting on the rest of my group to decide what actual game to play, sound muted of course. 

I think I picked this up in a grab-bag type thing of game codes so while I didn't get it for free, it was pretty close to such. I definitely wouldn't pay anything more than $1 for it otherwise.

review:
Dieses Spiel habe ich im Sale fÃ¼r gerade mal 0,30â‚¬ gekauft. Ich weis zwar nicht warum, aber ich habe es getan. EndgÃ¼ltig habe ich es installiert und gestartet, um die 5 Errungenschaften zu bekommen.

The Culling Of The Cows ist ein klassischer Tower Defense - Side roller, bei dem man als alter Farmer gegen mutierte ZombiekÃ¼he kÃ¤mpfen muss. Das Spiel ist grafisch gesehen fÃ¼r ein Tower Defense Spiel okay. Die Musik ist grÃ¶ÃŸtenteils passend zum Gameplay. Es gibt wie bereits erwÃ¤hnt 5 Errungenschaften, welche relativ schnell erreichbar sind. Das Gameplay selbst wird leider sehr schnell langweilig, da das Prinzip jedes Levels immer gleich ist.

Ich persÃ¶nlich muss leider sagen, dass ich kein Gamer bin, welcher diese Art von Spielen feiert. FÃ¼r richtige Kenner, ist es bestimmt eine schÃ¶ne Abwechslung fÃ¼r zwischen durch. review: Ehh should have been a flash game but that's not a thing anymore. It's not bad if you're into going up and down shooting at things coming from the right side of the screen. There is a lot of unpolished things that don't make me want to play this game again.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985797360', 'num_games_owned': 790, 'num_reviews': 389, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1624808433}
review:
Juego bÃ¡sico al estilo defensa de torres. TendrÃ¡s a un granjero con una escopeta y tu objetivo es repeler los ataques de vacas mutantes, zombies y algun que otro enemigo. Cada partida tienes algo de dinero para incrementar la capacidad del cargador, velocidad de disparo y la recarga aun mas rapida entre otras cosas.
Dispones de varias habilidades que se sacaran de mas de un problema cuando se acumulen muchos enemigos como torretas automaticas, bombas, cortinas de fuego... 

Se trata de unos 20 mapas aproximadamente del mismo estilo. la mision mas comun es defender varias oleadas sin que tus puntos de vida lleguen a cero, es decir, que no muchos enemigos traspasen tu puerta del rancho o cobertizo (como todos los juegos de este estilo). El otro mapa que hay es defenderte de una sola ola de enemigos bastante mas grande con un solo punto de vida. Y por ultimo, un mapa que dispararas con una ametralladora por norma general desde una ventana y tendrÃ¡s que repeler todos los enemigos con un maximo de 3 vidas.

A tener en cuenta que tu personaje no puede recibir daÃ±o, con que te toquen estas muerto y volverÃ¡s al inicio.

Un juego rapido, entretenido para varias horas (unas 3-4h). Malo no es, por lo tanto lo recomiendo si lo pillais a precio de risa.

author: {'steamid': '76561198994796062', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1616698794}
review:
This game saved my life.

I am 43.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiralling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198994064783', 'num_games_owned': 1174, 'num_reviews': 260, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1613268359}
review:
Guten Tag meine Lieben,

The Culling Of The Cows ist ein Side-Scrolling Shooter / Tower Defence Game.
Ihr spielt den alten Farmer Sammy, welcher, ausgerÃ¼stet mit einer Flinte, seine Farm vor Zombies, verschiedenen Arten von Zombie-KÃ¼hen und anderen Monstern verteidigen will.

Es gibt genug verschiedene Level um sich dort austoben zu kÃ¶nnen. Auch eigent sich dieses Game um seinen Tiltfaktor zu trainieren, da einige Level echt herausfordernd sein kÃ¶nnen.

The Culling Of The Cows hat zwar nur 5 Achievements, um aber 100% in diesem Game zu erreichen, mÃ¼sst ihr den Endboss besiegen (Ein Nazi-Ufo...), das heiÃŸt ihr mÃ¼sst das Game komplett durchspielen.

Ich habe dafÃ¼r ca. 4h gebraucht, den Rest der Zeit war ich mit fluchen beschÃ¤ftigt.

Ich wÃ¼rde zwar warten, bis es im Sale ist, aber ansonsten ist das ein nettes Minigame fÃ¼r zwischendurch.

Lg SyS

review:
This game is like... Really bad?
To all the completionists and card grinders out there, do not get lured by "only" five achievements, and a rare badge to earn.
This game has so many game design flaws, that even if it would be a student project, it would fail miserably. There is nothing "hilarious" about it, there is nothing "challenging" nor "strategic" about it. Whoever wrote this, was probably on something like Crystal Meth.

Do not buy it. If you receive it for free, just delete any knowledge about the key. This is a bad example of a video game, and if future civilisations would see this, it'd be just a bad example for our current (gaming) culture in total.

Really bad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002506911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 415, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1606460057}
review:
The Culling of the Cows is just not a great game.  It's quite simple.  You're an old farmer with a shotgun, you have zombie cows, zombies, baseball players, and more throughout the whole game that try and take over your farm.  You have to kill them before they get in your barn.  Some are slow, some are fast, and some take extra shots to put down.  You must reload manually, which makes it quite frantic, and the old man...well he's old and he's a bit slow on the walking around to better position himself to fight.

The graphics are decent for this type of game, but could definitely be better.  The sound effects are horrendous, they just end up annoying you especially as you repeat levels, and you'll repeat them often.  The music is not helping either, it's not bad, but it doesn't build any enthusiasm to want to fight.

What is wrong with the game is the feeling that it's been made difficult just by making you slow.  If the farmer was quick and agile and the enemies were strategically difficult that's one thing, but they are not, it's truly because of slow walking speed and slow reload speed that you die more times than not.

It was fun for a minute, but quickly got old especially once I hit those tough levels where I needed to replay them again and again.  Sorry, just can't recommend a grind fest game where there is not much thought put into making the game (UFO Nazis?) and not much thought into playing the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974313479', 'num_games_owned': 1211, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1602802971}
review:
It a very fun little game.
Like you see in the video, you move around a small area (it won't strafe, just the map changes) and you are shooting several zombie enemies.

You can upgarde your ammunition (4 different types), your weapon (max ammo, reload "speed", shooting speed and laser pointer) and you can call up to 4 different assists (like helicopter shooter) that will last a while and then will have a cool down.

Each level starts with nothing thou, you level up by credits during the level and then will decide what to upgrade best for this level. Also you can unlook ingame "badges" by not using certain upgrades.

There are 2 boss levels and a couple of levels where you shoot with a rifle from the barn.

For getting the 100 % you will have just to play the game throu, but the final boss is a bit more difficult than the rest of the game.

I played roughly 3 hours but will finish the ingame badges. I guess that will make it 4 or 5 hours then.
Fun game if you like what you see in the videos.

review:
Don't buy this game. Not worth it's price, it's just a glorified flash game with cluncky controls, bad hitboxes, ugly graphics and annoying sound. I'm glad I got this for free coz cards and achievements, but I had no patience to go through this game "fair and square". 
Spend your cash on something better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11207, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1596365076}
review:
This is a simple 2D hand drawn soldier-defense game where you control a redneck farmer and shoot various alien infested/diseased cows that attack your farm.  Move between different attack lanes and shoot your enemies with your upgraded weapons and ammunition.

This really feels like a flash/browser game.  The hand drawn art is mediocre but kind of passable.  Resolution and controls are fixed, so the technical implementation falls below minimum standards.  Despite the low quality, tablet-esque gameplay, the developers are charging $7.50 for this, the same price as older AAA games like Deus Ex: Human Revolution or Cities in Motion.  It's just not possible to recommend this when you can play Plants vs Zombies for free.

O que mata este jogo Ã© o controle, vocÃª controla o fazendeiro com WASD mas ele apenas atira em duas direÃ§Ãµes, frente em linha reta ou atrÃ¡s com alt-fire, o que nÃ£o seria tÃ£o ruim se as os inimigos nÃ£o fossem 10x mais rÃ¡pidos que vocÃª e as todas as hitboxes sÃ£o extremamente inconstantes e o fazendeiro morre com apenas um hit, o que gera vÃ¡rias situaÃ§Ãµes em que vocÃª erra o alvo que estÃ¡ bem na sua frente, sÃ³ pre morrer e ter que refazer o round,

O jogo permite que vocÃª compre upgrades de muniÃ§Ã£o e arma e personalize o seu arsenal e poderes extra, mas devido a falta de precisÃ£o. o Ãºnico upgrade que vocÃª precisa Ã© o birdshot que fragmenta o seu tiro. o resto nÃ£o presta, o jogo tem alguns desafios para terminar os rounds sem usar upgrades ou poderes, mas nÃ£o hÃ¡ nenhum incentivo para completar estes desafios.

No geral. o jogo parece um desses jogos mal-feitos de flash, dÃ¡ pra se divertir um pouco, mas Ã© muito frustante para recomendar.

review: The Culling Of The Cows es un Indie Tower Defence con algo de Estrategia en el que adoptamos el rol de Sammy, un granjero en medio de un apocalipsis zombie que debe proteger su granja con todo el arsenal que tenga a su disposiciÃ³n. Enfrentaremos oleadas de zombies, vacas zombies, gordas zombies y hasta un Ovni Nazi. Es un juego entretenido pero corto, de aproximadamente 5 horas en el que podemos upgradear nuestra arma principal y desbloquear habilidades especiales  para detener las hordas de zombies durante 40 niveles que cada vez son mÃ¡s feroces. Un juego recomendado para pasar el rato si te gusta eliminar oleadas de zombies sin sentido, ademÃ¡s en ofertas llega a costar $0.99.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132503739', 'num_games_owned': 601, 'num_reviews': 548, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1587013716}
review:
[b]My playtime:[/b] 6h (based on steam, 100% achievements, 100% completion).
[b]Grindy Achievement:[/b] No.
[b]Optional Achievement:[/b] Yes (3 achievements).
[b]Difficult Achievement:[/b] No.
[b]Developer Response:[/b] No (last response is in 17 Nov, 2016).

[h1]Intro[/h1]
[i]The Culling Of The Cows[/i] is a side-scrolling shooter game where you shoot zombie cows and humans to defend them from entering your barn. There are 41 levels with 3 different modes in total.

Pros:
- 41 levels
- 3 different modes
- You can adjust the difficulty yourself
- Upgrades
- Assists

Cons:
- Hard to see the text in the main menu
- Hard to listen to the tutorial voice
- Enemy hitbox isn't calculated in 3D location

[h1]Should you buy this game?[/h1]
[b]Yes.[/b]
[i]If you like to shoot zombies, you should buy this game.[/i]

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[h1]In-Depth Review[/h1]

[h1]Graphics[/h1]
This game uses 2D graphics with different backgrounds in each level. I like the fact that the background in each level matches with the background in the overworld. The zombies are also drawn beautifully - even after you've killed them. However, the main menu isn't as great as the game. The texts are hard to see and I don't see any value in the screen before the main menu since there's only the game title and "press <space> to continue" text in it.

[h1]The game[/h1]
As I said before, the game has 3 different modes: [i]Waves[/i], [i]Onslaught[/i], and [i]Kill them all[/i]. [i]Waves[/i] is a mode where you have to kill zombies in 2-7 waves depending on the level. [i]Onslaught[/i] is a mode where you use a gun with unlimited ammo to shoot enemies from the second floor of your barn. [i]Kill them all[/i] is similar to [i]Waves[/i] except that there is only one wave with more zombies in it and you can't let any zombies enter your barn.

This game also has one tutorial level. The rules of the game will be explained by a voice. I'm not sure if it's because of my bad listening skills or not but I couldn't seem to understand what was said. Luckily, there are also some texts that will explain the game mechanics in more detail.

You'll have a gun and some money in [i]Waves[/i] and [i]Kill them all[/i] modes to upgrade your weapon and/or ammo. The weapon upgrade consists of increasing the ammo count, reload count, and both shooting and reload speed. There is also an upgrade that gives an infra-red like thing to your gun to make it easier to aim.

You can also upgrade your ammo to give it more damage. There is ammo that is split into 3 different directions, ammo that can pierce through enemies, and ammo that can explode right into the target which will also kill enemies nearby. The amount of money that you can spend depends on each level though so you have to choose each upgrade wisely.

This game also has [i]Assists[/i] and [i]Supply drops[/i] features. [i]Assists[/i] is like a skill that can be activated to help you kill enemies. The [i]Assists[/i] that you get in each level are different and you need to wait for a while before using them again. On the other hand, [i]Supply drops[/i] is a powerup that can help to increase your speed or money. The tutorial said that it also has a cooldown like [i]Assists[/i] although I never used it that much to try it out.

The game itself is quite easy to beat if you use all of the upgrades and [i]Assists[/i] available. However, if you want to add some challenges, the game also offers 3 different optional objectives that you can aim for. [i]Waves[/i] usually has objectives to not let any zombies reach your barn, upgrade your weapon, and miss any shots while [i]Kill them all[/i] has objectives to not buy weapon upgrades, use [i]Assists[/i], and buy ammo upgrades. If you think that doing all 3 at once is too difficult, you can always do them one by one. Note that doing this is not necessary for obtaining 100% steam achievements so you can skip it if you want.

However, I think that the "not missing any shot" objective is bugged. I always got it as long as I upgraded my ammo even though I missed a lot of shots. It somehow fixed itself on one level though.

This game also has cheat codes that you can use to fool around. I haven't tried it out myself but I'm sure you can have fun with it if you like that kind of thing.

There are a lot of unique enemies in the game. There is a zombie that can dash super fast, a zombie that carry explosives, and so on. You'll need to think which one to prioritize and watch your step because although enemies usually come from the right side of the screen to the left side (where your barn is located), there is also an enemy that comes from top to bottom. However, the game doesn't seem to differentiate the hitbox in 3D since you'll still get hit if your head is in their landing spot.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
It's a fun game where you shoot zombies. You can upgrade your ammo and weapon and use [i]Assists[/i] to finish the game. You also can adjust the game difficulty yourself by completing objectives and/or using cheat codes.

[quote][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/23741321]Follow our curator page[b] Alexander's Club Curations[/b], if you like and want to see more reviews like this one.[/url][/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198260238008', 'num_games_owned': 319, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 465, 'last_played': 1586860635}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198083736752', 'num_games_owned': 526, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1589653136}
review:
The Culling Of The Cows is [b]the best example[/b] of a great idea but executed poorly. Not everyone can stomach that weird clunky control & the horrible enemies that came in rainbow colors. People were complaining about rock and roll tower defense being ugly and all that. here, this is a master-level of shit looking stuffs. intentionally or not, we'll never know.

[list]
    [*]I was rudely taken by surprised that I was not able to move my character's aiming. I can only shoot horizontally and my enemies could move in zig zags. Is this design intentional ?
    [*]I was also shocked to find out that I had to be reloading constantly, all throughout the campaign non-stop. 24 fucking 7 all day long.
This is the ultimate game challenge. Not the bloody cows/zombies. The fucking shotgun that can only hold 8 bullets without upgrades.
[/list]

This product reminded me of another product which i reviewed not too long ago. A run and gun 2D game that suffers from major hit box issue. stupid horde mode. same shit for over xx maps. Well at least here we have mini-bosses/boss. For all the interesting and creative ideas, the controls pulled this product down. Badly. I feel like the entire experience, i am gimping myself .. this game isn't hard. It's hard because of its fucking controls + cheap running horde mode. Which ultimately leads to a horrible gaming session.

*face palm. rips hair* I can't do this. 

No. Just fucking no. At this price, anyone who loves tower defense games like can look for better options in the current market. No hit box issue. no clunky controls. no cheap running horde mode.

Take back the nazi ufo and all this rainbow crap. Go back to farm simulator. It's much more rewarding. and fuck that giant finger too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090686914', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1582911615}
review: It's a wave defense type game. Gameplay can be frustrating and a bit bland. You walk and shoot cows. There are a few power-ups, but you start with cash at the beginning of each level and can't earn more to buy more upgrades. You then have to rebuy upgrades every level. It's basically the same game each level with some enemy variants. I don't recommend this game unless you're pretty bored.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089054085', 'num_games_owned': 450, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1559857044}
review: This game is really frustrating. It's a shame coz the graphics and sounds are on point but the gameplay itself is garbage. It's kind of a tower defense game, but you can't see the lanes the enemies are coming in and the hitboxes are quite small. That results in many missed shots and lots of frustration. Wouldn't pay money for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987256376', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1559470566}
review: Dont expect much and you will be entertained. Addition of assists (tower defense helpers) and upgrades are nice addition. I am however missing progression upgrades and more levels with alternated gameplay (like badger or final level). It is quite alright game for killing some time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012362002', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1559453468}
review:
[quote=Wasterbull] Indie Game [/quote]

[i]Zombie cows and an old man willing to defend his home from the most surreal invasion[/i]

[h1]	PLOT	[/h1]
[h1] [i] [code] You're an old man, that you must defend your home against zombie cows that are much more dangerous than zombies. Because the cows are kamikazes.[/code] [/i] [/h1] 


[h1]	GAMEPLAY	[/h1]
Easy to play, although at first you have to understand the system but it's easy. I think it's fun 'cause of the surreal thing about having to kill zombie cows and the weirdest final boss I've ever seen as player.

You can play with keyboard and mouse or joystick, it has many buttons like to recharge, buy and upgrade weapons, use special attacks. It's a decent game, at least it's fun.

The difficulty starts easy and as you advance each level, increases its difficulty and I think that the design of the levels are super basic, despite that it has some good challenge.

[h1]	GRAPHIC	[/h1]
Well, it's premise is simple and that's why it has a decent visual work, it's 2D and there's not much to say, it's just fun to see the zombie cows and an angry old man willing to kill anyone who invades their property.

[h1]	MUSIC	[/h1]
It's decent.

[h1]	NOTE 5.5/10	[/h1]

[h1]	MY OPINION ABOUT THE GAME	[/h1]
This caught my attention 'cause its absurd plot and interesting gameplay, I think it's fun game and it also has easy achievements.

[h1] PRO +[/h1]
[list]
    [*]A fun game and simple gameplay[/list]
    [*]5 Achievements for those who like to add more games completed at 100%[/list]

[h1]CONTRA -[/h1]
[list]
[*]The gameplay is a bit rough[/list]

    [*]I think the game is expensive because it's so short the duration[/list]

[code]I laughed a lot and it's a challenging game, if you are looking to kill time, it is a good option to play.[/code]

MÃªme si dans un premier temps il est bien marrant et amusant de faire un carnage avec toutes ces pauvres petites vaches zombifiÃ©es, il devient ensuite redondant de toujours exÃ©cuter la mÃªme tÃ¢che sans aucune variante.
Bien que le dÃ©cor et le bestiaire changent un peu, le gameplay quand Ã  lui reste identique du dÃ©but Ã  la fin, il n'y qu'une seule et unique arme on aurait apprÃ©ciÃ© pouvoir varier les plaisirs et en avoir d'autres sous la main.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082765157', 'num_games_owned': 9993, 'num_reviews': 163, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1550970401}
review:
This is a simple shoot em up, with some mild elements of tower defence.  However, I had a blast while playing and my interest was held right to the conclusion.

The premise of the game is ridiculous:  You are a farmer whose land has been overrun by zombie cows and other unholy terrors.  As a God fearing Southerner, you take it upon yourself to rid the world of these monstrosities with the aid of your trusty 12-gauge.

The game is a wave shooter, and it takes place from a side perspective.  Each level takes place on a single static screen.  You begin on the left hand side, outside your barn which you are protecting.  The beasts spawn on the right hand side, and try to make it past you and into the barn (presumably to feast upon your own animals).

To help you in your bovine killing mission, you have an upgradeable shotgun and a number of assists.  You start each level with a limited amount of cash which can be spent on various types of ammo or on certain aspects of the gun such as fire rate or capacity.  The assists are unlimited, but have a cool down rate.  They come in many forms, from a sentry gun to a nuclear bomb.  The upgrades and assists provide a small amount of strategy to what is otherwise just a blast em up.

There is a great deal of humour throughout; obviously a game about killing zombie cattle isn't going to take itself too serious.  This is clear through the visuals and the audio.

The graphics are colourful and cartoony.  The assets appear to be hand drawn for the most part, perhaps with the exception of the boss characters.  There can be quite a lot of characters on the screen at any one time, and I did notice some slowdown when the bodies (which do not disappear) began to pile up.  I'm sure most modern systems can handle it though.

The audio is similarly cartoon like.  The opening developer's logo splash screen is very telling on the quality of audio.  The logo features a cow jumping over the moon, and the "moo" which it emits is clearly not that of a bovine.  The farmer also has some very witty lines of dialogue, but it can be difficult to hear him over the constant blasting of the shotgun and the frantic music.

The soundtrack is very limited.  In fact I only noted two or three different tunes.  The music that accompanies each level is on a fairly short loop and it does get repetitive, but there are independent sliders for sound, music and dialogue.

I enjoyed my playthrough of this game, but I would suggest waiting to pick it up on sale.  The game reminded me of an old Flash game that was on the Mars Attacks website wayyy back when that movie released.

Probably not for animal rights activists or for anyone who may hold the cow sacred!

author: {'steamid': '76561198149137257', 'num_games_owned': 168, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1546951404}
review:
"The Culling Of The Cows" Ã© um jogo de aÃ§Ã£o 2D, que envolve muitos zumbis e sangue, foi desenvolvido e distribuido pera "DL Softworks" no dia 9 de maio de 2014. O jogo tem como personagem principal um fazendeiro (com um humor bem Ã¡cido) e sua doze, no qual o objetivo Ã© proteger os celeiros e chegar em sua casa, assassinando qualquer tipo de zumbi que apareÃ§a em seu caminho.

O jogo tem 11 tipos de inimigos (que variam de uma fase para outra), sendo eles, 6 vacas zumbis, 3 zumbis normais (humanos), 1 urso zumbi, e 1 corvo que fica tentando cair na tua cabeÃ§a. AlÃ©m dos inimigos normais, o jogo tambem contÃ©m um "Final Boss", sendo, nada mais e nada menos, que uma "Nazi UFO" ou seja um disco voador nazista, que transforma tudo em zumbi. D-O-I-D-E-R-A.

Para ajudar no seu combate (jÃ¡ que vocÃª sÃ³ possui uma doze) o jogo te da 4 modificaÃ§Ãµes (que te dÃ£o +balas, +capacidade de recarregamento, maior velocidade no tiro e uma mira, que no caso vai ser um rastro  vermelho), 4 tipos de muniÃ§Ãµes (normal, uma que se espalha (para mim a melhor), a que atravessa os inimigos e outra que explode), alguns "Supply Drop" e especiais temporÃ¡rios (como uma lamina que nÃ£o permite que os inimigos entrem dentro do celeiro, uma "Nuke", um aviÃ£o que solta bombas, outro aviÃ£o sÃ³ que com uma metralhadora, uma sentry e uma barreira de fogo).

O jogo Ã© bem divertido, possui uma jogabilidade simples/viciante e ainda por cima Ã© fÃ¡cil de platinar, jÃ¡ que o game possui apenas 5 conquistas, nas quais 4 delas envolvem apertar 4 botÃµes da mecÃ¢nica do jogo e a outra basta matar o "Final Boss" e zerar o jogo (para fazer isso tudo, leva em mÃ©dia de duas horas e no mÃ¡ximo umas trÃªs).

A trilha sonora Ã© legalzinha, acompanha o ritmo do game, e acaba fazendo o jogo passar mais rÃ¡pido do que ja Ã©.

ConclusÃ£o: o jogo vale sim a pena comprar para passar um tempo, porÃ©m nÃ£o custa nem de longe 20 reais, entÃ£o sÃ³ recomendo adquiri-lo, se estiver em uma promoÃ§Ã£o (de pelos menos 75%). 

Se comprou (apÃ³s a anÃ¡lise), basta instalar, iniciar e se divertir com esse indie viciante e criativo

IMPOSIBLE, tiene una dificultad increible (Siempre y cuando pases los niveles cumpliendo los tres requisitos opcionales que te pide cada nivel), si eres alguien al que le gustan los retos este juego es para ti.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083330899', 'num_games_owned': 1070, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1534101379}
review:
Voy a realizar el analisis directo de este titulo : The Culling Of The Cows"

Para los que os guste el genero Zombies mezclado con el toque de Tower Defense. Este es un titulo que no podras pasar por alto. El juego ofrece 40 niveles a cual mas dificil donde tendras que aguantar la horda de vaca que quiere entrar por la puerta del granero. Sammy (El prota) DueÃ±o y seÃ±or de las tierras, debe de poner punto final a la situacion a golpe de escopeta. 

Dentro del juego contamos con sistema de ganancias de dinero para poder aumentar nuestras defensas dentro de las partidas. Aparte de eso, podremos ir modificando las armas, el tipo de municion y habilidades especiales. 

Bajo mi punto de vista, es un juego que entretiene bastante y no es un titulo que dejaras pasar de largo. No es sencillo, puesto que cada tipo de vaca se caracteriza por una habilidad especial. Planifica tu municion y sobretodo, sobrevive a esta pesadilla.

Por aqui os adjunto un gameplay:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=l_I-YxuxTLA

Mi valoracion final es de 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197974220431', 'num_games_owned': 518, 'num_reviews': 173, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1534161188}
review:
Si tratta di un gioco flash abbastanza divertente (per essere un gioco flash) ma poco longevo.
Se sei un cacciatore di achievement e non vuoi perderci tempo, sappi che per portarli tutti a casa ci vuole meno di 10 minuti poichÃ© basta usare ogni potenziamento almeno una volta e poi con il cheat sblocchi tutti i livelli e uccidi l'ultimo boss.

review: Simple yet entertaining, minimal yet addictive. The Culling Of The Cows is unlike many games of this age. The smooth graphics and gorey design make this a thrilling, fluid experience. You'll quickly find yourself facing a formidable challenge. Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047188834', 'num_games_owned': 1892, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1532635329}
review:
I found this game enjoyable. I didn't see much explanation as to what the upgrades did though it didn't take long to figure them out. That being said, I also didn't encounter any real reason to change what upgrades I was buying each level outside of going for challenges. The challenges don't have much variety either, but do offer some replayability and certainly raise the difficulty.

The main menu has an entry for extras which didn't seem to do anything (maybe unlocked through completing challenges? nothing to suggest this to me).

author: {'steamid': '76561198024063593', 'num_games_owned': 1346, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1531605794}
review:
I cannot recommend this game at full price.  Its a very quick, maybe 2 hour experience that will frustrate you at first until you get the ammo upgrades, and then it just becomes a little tedious.  I received it for $1.75, and at that price I recommend it, but at the $7 full price, definitely not.

Pros:
- Simple game play for a quick distraction
- Easy 100% to pad your stats
- Dropping hordes of incoming enemies can feel satisfying

Cons:
- Over priced
- Mechanics are very wonky, and at times don't work well
- You repeat the same levels over and over, with very little differences after the first few (new enemies unlock, but there aren't enough enemies to keep it varied the whole way through)
- Would probably have been better suited for a mobile game

Again, if you can get it for under $2, it's a worthwhile distravtion, but it does not deliver much more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072598741', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1531547080}
review:
Fast-paced, nailbiting and visceral, both in nature and in content.

You enter this game thinking you're going to get a SINGLE A experience, frankly, this needs another A and i don't mean AA I MEAN AAAA.

Worth every goddamn penny, a MUST PLAY.

review:
The massacre of large crowds of incoming enemies is satisfying, but the aiming mechanic is completely F'd. It's hilarious at points, but completely tedious at others (where you're given a shotgun to protect a barn). Aim can be cheated due to bad handling of view angle, but it only works to a certain degree.

3/10

review: This game is crazy. It makes no sense. Even though I don't recommend it, if you're bored and don't mind paying for it, you might as well give it a try. You smile at how stupid some of the gameplay is.

review:
Maldita sea.... quÃ© difÃ­cil !!!
Reconozco que los juegos de disparos no se me dan bien pero... pero... yendo por la quinta ronda de zombies en uno de los primeros escenarios... cuando estoy convencido de que a la treintava vez lo consigo.... me quedo sin balas por despiste y me embisten!!! +Vuelta a empezar desde el inicio...que frustrante!!

Recomendado 10/10 con una advertencia; si eres medio manco como yo en juegos de disparos tomate una tila antes de jugarlo. La necesitaras.

review:
Un buen granjero con su escopeta quiere evitar que las vacas zombies entren a su establo. 
El juego es como un "shoot them up" de los que se jugaban en los arcades de principios de los 90s  (como cadillacs & dinosaurs, Captain Commando, Los Simpsons, Final Fight), pero mezclado con zombies. Al principio te aparecen vacas pero despuÃ©s vienen todo tipo de alimaÃ±as del campo. 
Estos malditos zombies quieren entrar, seguramente estÃ© un OVNI nazi detrÃ¡s de todo eso.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972040704', 'num_games_owned': 1844, 'num_reviews': 725, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1511501429}
review:
Full disclosure: I won this game from a random drawing, and I have not been asked to review it.

This was a goofy-looking game that I actually really wanted to play, so when I finally got my hands on it, I wasn't expecting much, but hoped it would be a bit of silly fun. It is indeed silly, with God speaking directly to the player and offering His assistance in battles (via turrets, carpet-bombing, fires, buzz-saws, etc.), and enemies consisting of drunk cows, cows of a variety of colors, and different types of zombies, reminiscent of the absurd themed zombies from Plants vs Zombies.

From a comedy angle, I think the game was pretty alright. The jokes and sight gags weren't amazing or anything, but it worked fine, I think. My qualms with the game lie entirely with the gameplay. Zombies (mostly cows) move from right to left, trying to get into your barn. If ten get by, you lose. If one touches you, you lose. Getting between them and the barn can cause an instant loss, making you restart the entire mission over, which can get pretty aggravating. This encourages you to simply hang out at the bottom- or top-corner of the left side of the screen and just let enemies march on by, because getting touched by 1 is worse than missing 9, which I think is a poor design mechanic in a video game. It makes sense in a zombie apocalypse, but isn't fun or conducive to good defensive gameplay.

You do not use the mouse to aim. You have to line up with your enemy on an X axis to shoot them. If you're not lined up just right, you miss. It's generally pretty easy to hit, but when a miss can cost you the entire mission by getting you hit by a drunk cow staggering into you right after your miss, that's annoying. You can purchase special ammo that spreads your shots to help with this, but that money is often better spent on other upgrades instead...except for the laser sight. I found it to be pretty useless, and there isn't enough time when tons of enemies are rushing at you for you to try lining up a laser sight. It's just better to get used to it and shoot, hoping for success.

Speaking of money for upgrades...you cannot get money by killing enemies, nor is it guaranteed over time. You start with a set amount, and any additional funds are dropped by pressing E when a cooldown finishes. You see, the supply drop only [i]might[/i] be cash, though. It's random. Instead, you could get about ten seconds of invincibility, ten seconds of faster movement, a reload of your gun, or infinite ammo for ten seconds; all so-so rewards that pale in comparison 9 times out of 10 when compared with what cash can get you. This random element makes reliable strategies in upgrading in a mission non-existent after spending the starting funds, and does a great disservice to the upgrade system as a whole.

Birds dive-bomb the player, and even though they are portrayed as coming straight down from the sky, you will die instantly if you are in line with their Y axis prior to them touching the ground. I think this could have been better illustrated to show the bird actually flying in the line, instead of showing a glowy line that passes through you and the bird then not actually flying at an angle that could possibly hit you. I was standing 8 feet away on two occasions and died instantly from the crashing bird.

Each level tends to have bonus objectives, such as not upgrading your gun, not letting any zombies past, etc., but no Steam achievements appear to correlate with completing these objectives, and the game did not make any indication that completing these objectives was rewarding me in some way, so I stopped bothering with them. I got through 13 missions after the tutorial and never really found myself enjoying the game. Between having to restart due to touching any enemy once, the questionable "aiming," no rewards for special objective completion, and the randomized upgrade funding, I found nothing to enjoy about this game after the humor ebbed away a few minutes in.

[i]Seja um fazendeiro enfezado com aliens nazistas que disseminou um vÃ­rus zumbi em seu gado.[/i] 

Sim, este Ã© o maior resumo do jogo.  O jogo em si prÃ³prio Ã© bastante divertido e com uma mecÃ¢nica simples, ou seja, vocÃª se movimenta e atira. Seu principal objetivo Ã© impedir que o gado contaminado invada a sua propriedade. 
Em cada mapa, vocÃª conta com as principais ajudas (por tempo limitado) e sem contar com os upgrades que vocÃª faz para ajudar a eliminar zumbis bovinos e alguns walkers tambÃ©m. 

O jogo conta com diversos tipos de zumbis gados, desde algumas que andam devagar atÃ© gados do Estado IslÃ¢mico (quando elas morrem, explodem). 

Os grÃ¡ficos nÃ£o Ã© feio e nem bonito, Ã© atÃ© charmoso para a proposta em si do game, tambÃ©m possui 5 conquistas que sÃ£o bem fÃ¡ceis de conseguir. 

Eu recomendo sim este jogo, mas sÃ³ em uma promoÃ§Ã£o. 26 temers Ã© bastante dinheiro. Eu peguei este jogo Ã  muito tempo atrÃ¡s e sÃ³ vim jogar ele praticamente em 2016.

review:
[h1]The Culling Of The Cows / El Sacrificio de las Vacas[/h1]
Â¿Alguna vez quisiste detener el apocalipsis vacuno zombie para que no entren a destrozar tu ganado y cosecha? Bueno, en este juego serÃ¡s tu el granjero Macho Alfa que detenga a estas abominables criaturas con tu arsenal ([i]Escopeta[/i]) y demÃ¡s que estan en tu granja.
[h1]Lo Bueno:[/h1]
[list]
[*][b]La estÃ©tica simplista y casi Cartoon que parece un juego Flash ([spoiler]No se si realmente lo es[/spoiler]) puede que no enganche al principio, pero mientras mÃ¡s vas jugando este grotesco juego y veas la pila de vacas zombies muertas en el camino empezarÃ¡ a hurgar algo dentro de ti para seguir Disparando a sus cabezas podridas Â¡Buajaja![/b]
[*][b]La mÃºsica y efectos de sonido son muy buenos y quedan muy bien con el estilo de juego.[/b]
[*][b]El diseÃ±o de niveles y economÃ­a del juego es muy balanceado y aunque los niveles cuestan cuando vas avanzando es un desafÃ­o justo y reconfortante.[/b]
[*][b]Hay gran variedad de niveles y enemigos, ademÃ¡s de como ya dije armas para asesinar a esas vacas.[/b]
[*][b]El precio es mÃ¡s que asequible para tu billetera, si quieres pasar un buen rato te lo recomiendo.[/b]
[/list]
[h1]Lo Malo:[/h1]
[list]
[*][b]No hay ningÃºn bug, pero tengo que decir que a veces la hitbox y disparar podrÃ­an complicarse un poco en niveles avanzados, pero tampoco es tan mal punto como crees.[/b]
[/list]
[quote=Marloncha]YOU MISSED ONE THERE![/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198039844511', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1505001468}
review: I recieved this in a bundle and was actually pleasantly surprised.  It has a nice art style and the gameplay is fluid and challenging at points with various power ups to unlock.  However I can't recommend it at the current price.  If it was a couple dollers, it would definitly be worth the bit of mindless fun, but you can get a lot of huge AAA games on steam in the 10-15$ range that are leagues better time/value then this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198397678963', 'num_games_owned': 436, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1503095099}
review:
Antes de comenzar querÃ­a avisar que soy un [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/30566290-%C2%ABWeLoveBlu%C2%BB/]"Mentor"[/url] y agradecerÃ­a que me siguieras, hago criticas extensas(Hay casos en los que no, por razones especificas), verdaderas y solo analizo juegos que les haya dedicado tiempo.

[h1]Introduccion:[/h1]Instalamos, abrimos y nos dan un tutorial(interfaz ,etc), tenemos que resistir oleadas de tanto como animales zombies y zombies, el juego tiene su tema comico(o intentos de este, que por cierto no hay traducciones al espaÃ±ol de nada). Desde el primer nivel hasta el ultimo hay pequeÃ±as variaciones de lo que hay que hacer, a veces nos podemos mover libremente, a veces estamos estaticos en un lugar(algo asi como un centinela), pero no hay mas variacion que esa. El juego se vuelve rapidamente cansador y repetitivo, nivel tras nivel es lo mismo, y ni hablar cuando estas en la ultima oleada y solo una vaca te toca, mueres y tenes que reiniciar el nivel completo. Por [u]suerte[/u] el juego cuanta con 	[u]"comandos o cheats"[/u] incluidos ( [i]hay una guia de esto[/i] ) y  te podes poner ([i]entre otras cosas[/i]) todos los niveles y derrotar el ultimo  jefe ([i]cuya batalla es aburrida y hay una guia que en simple cuatro pasos te enseÃ±a a derrotarlo[/i]) y ganarte el logro. [b]El juego me parece absurdo su precio de al dia de hoy(26/08/2017) cueste $12,99[/b]
[h1]Desarrollo:[/h1]

[b]-TecnologÃ­a:[/b]Gran fluidez como consecuencia de ser un juego 2D, los paisajes son feos y el modelo de muchas de los objetos, enemigos, etc, tambien.

[b]Jugabilidad:[/b]Repetitiva y cansador, el juego se vuelve rapidamente aburrido y realmente si alguien se lo pasa sin uso de comandos dentro del juego creo que jamas lo  volveria a jugar.

[b]-GrÃ¡ficos:[/b]El Juego es 2D, a veces el movimiento no concuerda con el escenario y parece que estamos levitando por el mapa, los movimientos de los enemigos se ven horribles, hasta las balas, el juego fue lanzado en 2014 el 9 de mayo pero juegos mucho mas viejos se ven mejor.

[b]-Sonido y Musica:[/b]Es la misma cancion todo el tiempo, que da una sensacion frenetica al juego y de locura, el sonido de las explosiones y balas, se oye un poco "meh" pero es aceptable.

[b]-InnovaciÃ³n:[/b]No innova en casi nada, pocos logros, en el juego hay mejoras o "upgrades" para tus armas, ademas de powers-up, pero el resto e visto titulos muy parecidos.
[h1]Puntuacion final:4,1[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198153894963', 'num_games_owned': 471, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1502321195}
review:
I only installed because I was curious about that title (it sounded interesting enough). At first everything looks nice, like there is an options menu and controls are explained. 
Tutorial is way too easy, but after stage 1.2 this game becomes [b] real hard [/b] 
No money means no upgrades, which means you are very likely to die. Possibly during the last wave. Which can only be described as infuriating. The one saving grace here is that there's a cheat console! 

The only game mode I really liked was Onslaught (unlimited ammo [b] and [/b] you get a crosshair!). If only them QoL features were ported over to story mode...hell, it would've been somewhat enjoyable if that was the case. But nah, you shoot, and there's about 50% chance for the shot to be a near miss. That means you die, by the way. 
This ain't worth any money simply because...it's pretty lame. I can't recommend it. 

[b] Final thoughts [/b]
Some improvements would be nice. As I said, impossible to beat without the cheat console. Make it so that the character doesn't have to reload as often and have that crosshair on at all times. There, fixed the game for ya :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198168652102', 'num_games_owned': 127, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 1460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1241, 'last_played': 1601995340}
review:
EDIT:

Replayed more than 3 years later, I clearly haven't apreciated this game enough.
It's a really well made game, it has level diversity, it's super interesting, a bit of a challenge, especially the last level and it's a great game, you can have a lot of fun with it and I truly recomend it.

23 iul. 2017

This game is fun! Not a lot but it's a good time waster.
It has enough diversity to keep you playing.
The thing is that I got this game in a bundle on my birthday so I can't recommend you to buy it for it's price. It's not much but I just would not buy it so I can't recommend you to do it.
But if you get your hands on it for a lower price or free definetely give it a try.
I'll give it a 7/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198188184794', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1500171980}
review:
Imagine the famous and disgusting Mad Cow's disease placed together with the cruelty of the videos by PETA and you've got the bloodbath which is The Culling Of The Cows 

The game is alright, nor is it horrible, nor is it unplayable. The game follows a farmer who tries to protect his barn/farm from the diseased alien cows and human zombies. The game is like a tower defense game, where you play the farmer shooting your way through hordes of cows, with a little variety here and there. The concept is okay but can get a little repetitious at certain parts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041012754', 'num_games_owned': 482, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1497217116}
review:
It is certainly a game, but that is pretty much about it. You will do pretty much the same thing every level without too much variety. With 40 levels, it really wears on you. The hit detection is really spotty and some elvels you "defend against waves" of enemies but have no idea how many waves that is. 

When you die (due to spotty hit detection, usually never your fault) you'll end up frustrated having to grind through multiple boring waves again and again. 

The game also punishes you for using any of its features (most levels give you extra cash for not upgrading the gun/using any powers..... so..... why would you need cash if that is the unlock requirements every time?).

It really just gets boring pretty quick once you realize nothing in it ever changes. Aslo the "Extras" menu does not and never will do anything. You can skip it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115086953', 'num_games_owned': 1375, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1466982408}
review:
A flash game that may kill time, but offers very little content for its price.  You play a farmer who must protect his farm(s?) from the deadly invasion of zombie cows/humans/etc. Building up score to put points in various devices and weapon upgrades to help stop further waves from reach the barn.  Heavy redundancy, and cheap feeling gameplay gave me the feeling of a cheap flash game you would find online. It's difficulty can vary by the challenges you wish to attempt on each area, but no rewards otherwise.
It most certainly doesn't deserve the price on steam, but should only be bought cheap for a cheap time killer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198354650257', 'num_games_owned': 210, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1495113966}
review:
Buen juego, no obstante, empezarÃ© diciendo que no vale la pena pagar 11â‚¬ por el simplemente por una cuestiÃ³n de durabilidad:

Es un buen juego en 2D de defensa zombie, pero me ha dado solo para un par de horas, y con eso, he completado ya el juego entero (Logros incluidos)

-Lo mejor para mi es la simplicidad del juego, en parte esa sencillez hace que juegues una, y otra, y otra partidas seguidas
-Visualmente no es ninguna maravilla del otro mundo, pero esto se entiende al ser un 2D Pasivo
-A pesar de morir bastantes veces no llega a ser del todo frustrante, lo cual es complicado de conseguir en este tipo de juegos 
Lo peor:

-El precio, por 11â‚¬ en steam tienes mejores juegos, tanto calidad como cantidad, y mÃ¡s horas de juego, pero bueno, no me quejo, ya que el tiempo que he jugado me lo he pasado muy bien
-A veces, a pesar de que claramente estÃ¡s disparando a un objetivo, las balas no le alcanzan por un pequeÃ±o fallo en los calibrados

Le pongo un 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198105569917', 'num_games_owned': 431, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1483803972}
review:
[i]Tout dâ€™abord, je tiens Ã  prÃ©ciser que jâ€™ai reÃ§u le jeu dans un pack de clÃ© steam (je n'ai donc pas payez le prix de Steam).[/i]

[h1][b][i][u] The Culling Of The Cows[/u] quâ€™est-ce que câ€™est ?[/i][/b][/h1][list]
[*][i][u] The Culling Of The Cows[/u] est un jeu indÃ©pendant de tir et un Tower-Defence en vue de profil. Vous y incarnez un fermier schizophrÃ¨ne dÃ©fendant sa ferme dâ€™une invasion de vaches mutantes. [/i][/list]

[h1][b][i]Les points positifs du jeu :[/i][/b][/h1][list]
[*] Le jeu est trÃ¨s fun. Le simple fait de tuer des zombies me rend content, alors si on doit tuer des centaines de VACHES zombies dans ce jeu je pense que le mot Â« fun Â» est le plus appropriÃ©.
[*] Le gameplay est simple Ã  prendre en main. Il y a une seule difficultÃ©, je trouve, câ€™est de repÃ©rer notre position sur lâ€™axe vertical.
[*] La bande son sâ€™intÃ¨gre trÃ¨s bien au jeu et au gameplay (Elle rentre trÃ¨s bien dans le cÃ´tÃ© WTF du jeu).
[/list]

[h1][b][i]Les points nÃ©gatifs du jeu :[/i][/b][/h1][list]
[*] Le jeu est seulement disponible en QWERTY. MÃªme si cela se rÃ¨gle assez facilement Ã§a reste assez chiant.
[*] Le jeu est beaucoup trop cher pour sa durÃ©e de vie.
[*] Le jeu commence Ã  devenir rÃ©pÃ©titif Ã  la fin.
[*] MÃªme si elle est bien, la bande son peut commencer Ã  Ã©nerver au bout dâ€™un moment.
[/list]

[h1][b][i]Pour rÃ©sumer: [/i][/b][/h1][list]
[*][i][u] The Culling Of The Cows[/u] est un trÃ¨s bon petit jeu pour passer le temps. Certes le prix (sur Steam) peut faire piquer les yeux, mais vous pouvez le trouvÃ© trÃ¨s facilement sur des sites de revendeurs pour moins dâ€™1â‚¬ ou dans des packs de clÃ© randoms Steam (comme câ€™est mon cas)
[*]Je vous recommande donc le jeu si vous aimez les jeux dÃ©calÃ©s et sans prises de tÃªte et surtout si vous adorez tuez des vaches, des zombies ou les deux !

author: {'steamid': '76561197982117522', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1081, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1491377035}
review:
They really don't hide much from you, a red neck farmer killing zombie cows...with nazi spacecraft thrown in for good flavor.

It's absurd and strange, a kind of stupid fun that won't keep you around very long but fufills the 'What the hell is this?' moment we all have sometime.  That moment is the only reason I picked this up at all (well that and it was pretty heavily discounted at the time). 


Is it worth it?
 -  For $13?  Heh, GOD no.  But if you find it on a decent sale, go ahead. 


P.S.
Achievement hunters will probably like the easy 100% as well

Ya'll have fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198004482707', 'num_games_owned': 1181, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 537, 'last_played': 1491242853}
review: Ugly artstyle and graphics, monotonous gameplay that becomes repetitious and stale rather quickly, with a difficulty curve that makes it a chore to restart if you die. The only sense of progression is "Hey I beat a stage, let's go to the next of 40"; upgrades are tied to individual stages so knowing you'll always start at base settings each stage is disheartening. A disappointment that reminded me why I abandoned it the last time I played Sammy's sad adventure.
