author: {'steamid': '76561197966720521', 'num_games_owned': 3409, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1489828228}
review:
Juego de corte desenfadado estilo "defensa de la torre", pero donde controlamos directamente a un granjero ante hordas de vacas zombi y otros putrefactos seres. Ideal para echar unas cuantas horas, que es lo mÃ¡ximo que puede durar, y en las que ademÃ¡s se puede completar todos los logros.

Basa su mecÃ¡nica en el "ir a ojo", ya que es muy fÃ¡cil fallar al disparar si no colocamos nuestro personaje en la posiciÃ³n exacta. Por fortuna hay diferentes tipos de municiÃ³n que facilitan las cosas, asÃ­ como ciertas mejoras y ayudas que se pueden ir solicitando a lo largo de los niveles. La mayorÃ­a son de defensa contra varias oleadas gestionando nuestros recursos (dinero) para comprar mejoras, aunque algunos niveles son de una Ãºnica oleada.

Creo que estÃ¡ bastante bien para pasar el rato, sin grandes pretensiones.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079704709', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 271, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1487919935}
review:
The Culling of the Cow is a TD game, and one that has us placed in a man v.s zombie scenario. At a first glance, it doesnâ€™t seem too special until you realize that instead of undead humans we are battling â€¦ cows! (Moo.)

I see this as a different and humorous concept. The design and art fits your usual arcade game with some blocky animations and linear movements. The effects are there and done appropriately, such as the blood. Iâ€™m satisfied that this has not been overdone, as many Zombie shooter tends to exaggerate the bloodletting. Though the amount of dead cows that build up after each wave is another story.

The gameplay has a progress system where with every waves completed, brings us to a new and more difficult setting. New cows will be introduced. Item drops, assists and upgrades exist too. The overall difficulty of the game isnâ€™t too harsh though, and there will be an eventually pattern you will find to completing each wave: whether itâ€™s your movement or pattern of shooting, to the number of cows that will spawn.

The life points and no. of cows that spawn are shown on the top of the screen during each wave, which are helpful.

The BGM is full of energy, being mainly music of an electric guitar. The sound effects are there, when you shoot or hit a target. There is also a voice announcement for every wave completed and starting. All these comments pretty much wraps up my review for the game, and I do recommend others to try it out as well!

author: {'steamid': '76561198083840190', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1488105887}
review: Me gusto la idea, una especie towwer defense arcade y bizarro, lastima que le veo muchos puntos negativos, por ejemplo el no tener mas idiomas ni siquiera en la interfaz, el hecho de que el personaje no tenga un progreso fijo, todos los upgrade se resetean lvl tras lvl, creo que en algunos niveles la curva de dificultad es demasido alta tambien,y el hecho de tener un poco de todo( tipos de disparo,asistnetes,upgrades) y mucho de nada ya que estas obligado a usar una enorme cantidad de botones para controlar todo, mas que los d eun moba por ejemplo, los 2 botones del mouse, las 4 teclas direcionales, xcver y ademas los numeros del 1 al 7, me parece excesivo, un juego que seria mejor si fuera mas simple peromas concreto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041115695', 'num_games_owned': 1061, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1485704082}
review:
I'm a bit torn on this game and really wish I could leave a medium option for recommendations. I got the game on a pretty steep discount for around 5ish dollars and 100% the game in around 3 and a half hours without very much difficulty at all.

Culling is just a "defend the base against zombies" game that were huge on sites like Kongregate and Newgrounds for a while in the 2010s, and not much is done to change the formula. That's not necessarily a bad thing, as a bit of mindless fun is sometimes a good break from heavy gameplay or story games, but you won't be experiencing anything particularly groundbreaking in terms of gameplay.

I'd probably give this a positive overall score if the price were in the 2-5 dollar range but asking for almost as much as the cost for Hollow Knight is ridiculous. There's much better games to spend 12 bucks on, and considering this genuinely feels like a flash game you could get for free I'd look elsewhere.

4/10 would only recommend if you want to reminisce about the flash game days.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056526000', 'num_games_owned': 217, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1454472063}
review:
Never before has a game been so graceful yet simplisitc in its execution, The smash hit "The Culling Of The Cows" deserves to be mentioned among such greats as Dragon age Origins, and the Witcher 3.  

In "Culling Of The Cows" you play as a former pacifict vegan farmer who finds himsefl in the midst of an apocalypse.   One day upon arriving home our hero finds his entire family ripped to pieces by a swarm of zombie cows, as he holds his dying son he vows to Cull as many cows as he possibly can before he is inevitably overun. 

A modern masterpiece of narrative storytelling.

10/10 Sensational.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128879898', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 150, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1625399671}
review: This game shows us how an average girl (pictured in the game as an old farmer) has to get through life while being swarmed by the countless numbers of simps (symbolized by cows). It's fun. If you're vegan, I don't recommend it. Eat grass instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018095117', 'num_games_owned': 1060, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1483315450}
review:
The game itself is not bad (which is why I want steam to put review that are neutral) and can be quite fun for some people who are into these kind of games, and unlike some other pieces of shit that they're on steam this one is very functional and can have some charm in the jokes.

However, I choose to put a not recommended mainly because of the price and what it offers. Since it's way to expensive IMO and it's better to get it on a sale.

Gameplay
It plays as your average defence flash game where you defend your barn from zombie cows, and you can upgrade your bullets or gun. The game just gets a little difficult if you're trying to get the achievements (which serve no purpose at all since you don't get better stuff from them), but ignoring them the game is very easy.
It has about around 40+ levels so it should give some time to beat them all.

Story
The theme of the game alredy says that it doesn't take itself seriously, so the story means jack shit.

Graphics
They are pretty decent and serve their purpose, it does show that the developer put effort in making the graphics so kudos for that.

Music
They serve their purpose and a lot of songs will be repeated in the game. But that won't make any of them memorable at all. Since they sound generic and not something that will leave you an impact like other games.

Overrall
It's a nice decent game, but again not worth the original price, very forgettable and you'll probably never going to play it again unless you're really into playing these games.

You're better off using that money elsewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078193056', 'num_games_owned': 140, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1480607592}
review:
[b][i]"GET OUT OF MY DAMN FARM!"[/i][/b]

I don't really think that after all those long reviews I did, I'll be able to write that much about The Culling of The Cows.
From the creator of Pixel Puzzles, you might already know  that what you get will most probably be some kind of dead filled game with that typical old school feeling. 
I don't even want to call this tribute to the games that used to look like this because I feel like it's not, but what I want to call it is most probably the "tribute" to those B type movies from 80s about american farms, dead cows, UFOs and denim workpants with flannel shirt. That might sound stupid as hell, but I bet you saw at least one like that. And I didn't mean The X-Files. 

What to say about gameplay? Nothing much to be honest - 40 levels and 95% of them repetetive with no actual "progress" but well, you can't even be expecting that much out of arcade shooter game that requires 4 buttons to play. Different ammo types and power ups was at least those elements that freshened up the overall levels and gameplay, because kinds of animals you was facing didn't do it. Music was not good at all but you gotta hear it.  5 Achievements and Steam Trading Cards - minimum that could be done so no bonus points.

Price tag is really not very-well choosen. 11â‚¬ is too much and even if it was half of that, it would be too much.

Yes, I am putting thumbs up for it and it's just because there is no neutral option and it's either UP or DOWN and if you play this game as a product to get angry really fast and bored really fast that's UP, but if you want something out of that then it's THUMBS DOWN.

[b]Bonus Point: NAZI UFO[/b]
[h1]Rating: 5/10[/h1]

review:
Un tower defense senza troppe pretese, puÃ² diventare abbastanza addictive, del tipo "faccio l'ultima e poi smetto" e si fanno le 6 del mattino. In realtÃ  con un pÃ² di strategia nella gestione dei bonus, lo si finisce anche in meno di una nottata.

Per essere un indie ha poche sbavature tecniche, forse giusto ogni tanto qualche hitbox crea frustrazione. Gli achievement una volta tanto non sono buggati e il completamento Ã¨ alla portata di tutti.

A prezzo pieno sicuramente Ã¨ eccessivo, coi saldi a -90% Ã¨ un must-have.

review:
Culling of the Cows ist ein kleiner 2D-Shooter in dem ihr eure Farm vor angreifenden ZombiekÃ¼hen beschÃ¼tzen mÃ¼sst.

Die Farm ist in viele kleine Level unterteilt in denen ihr jeweils mehre Wellen ZombiekÃ¼he in verschiedenen Variationen und weitere Gegener eliminieren mÃ¼sst. 
Dazu habt ihr eine Schrotflinte, die ihr mit mehreren Powerups ausrÃ¼sten kÃ¶nnt und in jeden Level stehen verschiedene Spezialwaffen zur VerfÃ¼gung.

Ein kurzweiliger SpaÃŸ fÃ¼r Zwischendurch. Einfach mal n paar ZombiekÃ¼he Ã¼ber den Haufen ballern/in die Luft sprengen. Wer ne groÃŸe Story erwartet ist hier fehl am Platz. Von mir ne klare Kaufempfehlung.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044098311', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1549441132}
review:
simple y divertido, son vacas zombis que quieren arruinar a toda tu granja esparciendo el virus, para evitarlo debes de matarlas antes de que lleguen a tu granero o que sean mas de las que puedas controlar dentro de este, es muy estilo plantas vs zombis pero con la diferencia de que todas las lineas defensa con un solo personaje al cal si puedes ver (no como en Pvz) tambien tendras ayuda de armas especiales y practicamente comodines que te ayudaran a despejar las lineas de defensa, de hasta los mas trickis zombis vacas. 

Cabe destacar que puedes dejar pasar algunas vacas zombis pero si una te ataca a ti, estas muerto y tendras que empezar el nivel desde el principio, ojo, no la zona, solo ese nivel.

review:
This shooter has many good points - variety in shell types and assists and -level achievements-  (using only standard shell, not using assists , not purchasing store upgrades)

I havent reached very far yet - but in each level they add diferent types of Foes
i have see crazy cows that are slow, others run fast, other have TNT stapped on them etc.. xD armageddon hahaha

overall is a very good 2D shooter 

Try it for some fun if you enjoy the gender xD

author: {'steamid': '76561197977088954', 'num_games_owned': 685, 'num_reviews': 228, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1476086747}
review:
El juego es un tower defense en toda regla.
Esta muy bien, la jugabilidad es buena y a mi en particular me ha gustado.
Los graficos no son nada del otro mundo, si habeis jugado al metal slug, este se parece graficamente.
Lo Ãºnico malo es el tiempo de juego que es cortÃ­simo. En una hora lo puedes superar facilmente. El resto del tiempo es de espera a que te den los cromos.

Lo recomiendo si os lo regalan o lo pillais por menos de un euro. Entretiene un rato.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106659663', 'num_games_owned': 915, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1474639557}
review:
[h1] The Culling Of The Cows [/h1] 

[h1] Pros : [/h1]
[list]
 [*]Nice graphics.
 [*]Some fun humor.
 [*]A reasonable variety of enemies.
 [/list]

[h1] Cons : [/h1]
[list]
 [*]Very, very repetitive.
 [*]You will be frustated a times,because you die if an enemy hits you (you have only 1 chance and if you die you will repeate the level from the begging).
 [*]Levels are too long.
 [*]Some hitboxes are glitched.
 [*]Only 3 gamemodes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043769082', 'num_games_owned': 319, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1474794284}
review:
I like the artstyle a lot, seems to be handdrawn which is cool.
The  game itself is really fun, although I'm having a problem getting some of the level achievements, 2nd map I missed no shots but still got a failure on that one but no biggie.
The music really fits the atmosphere of hellish cows trying to  take over your barn, made my head nod.
Else I didn't have any problems gameplay wise, you'd think it would be hard to line up the shots but it's actually pretty precise, you can even shoot behind you in case you missed a cow.
This game isn't easy but it's challenging enough to not be unfair, plus you get sentries and all that good stuff.
Definitely going to play this in the future, it's a nice little casual game, too good to just be on a website so I understand it's offered as a full game.

Not bad!

review:
En lo personal me ha encantado! Pero vamos por partes, la jugabilidad es mas bien reducida, solo 4 direcciones y ademÃ¡s el enemigo vendrÃ¡ siempre por la derecha. Las graficas no son la gran cosa, encajan bien, es un juego en 2D. En sÃ­ es mas bien, corto, no deberÃ­a tomarnos mucho tiempo llegar al final de todo. Pese a esto algunos niveles del juego presentan cierta complejidad debido a que tendremos que estar constantemente recargando y Sammy no es muy rapido en ello. Por lo demas es entretenidisimo y nos puede sacar el aburrimiento un rato. 

Ahora bien, si lo que nos interesa es una maravilla de obra, no es tal:

Calidad grafica: 4/10
DiseÃ±o de los niveles: 7/10
Sonido: 6/10
Controles: 6/10

review:
Je pense que la plupart des Ã©valuations nÃ©gatives le sont Ã  cause du prix du jeu, et elles ont raison.
11â‚¬ pour ce jeu c'est juste pas possible !

Mais on ne juge pas la qualitÃ© d'un jeu Ã  son prix.

Et en effet, ce jeu est plutÃ´t marrant, rÃ©pÃ©titif mais c'est le gameplay qui veut Ã§a.

On se retrouve fermier devant sa grange, Ã  tenter de la proteger des vagues d'ennemis zombies et vaches zombies qui essayent de la pÃ©nÃ©trer. Voila le principe.

C'est avec une certaine somme d'argent fournie en dÃ©but de partie que vous allez pouvoir choisir une combinaison de compÃ©tences et d'amÃ©liorations qui devront Ãªtre bÃ©nÃ©fiques pour mener votre tÃ¢ches Ã  bien, des munitions qui s'eparpillent, recharger plus vite, avoir plus de munitions etc.

C'est un gameplay qui est plutÃ´t bon si on arrive Ã  maitriser un peu l'axe Z, parce que fournir de la profondeur Ã  un jeu en 2D ou on doit tirer sur des modÃ¨les 2D plats, c'est parfois pas facile.

Le jeu propose plusieurs modes de jeu qui gardent un peu tous le mÃªme gameplay : Survivre Ã  des vagues d'ennemis, tuer une seule vague d'ennemis plus nombreuse, se nicher en haut de sa grange et viser au curseur les ennemis (f*cking roofcamper), combats de boss etc.

Globalement un bon jeu, pas une rÃ©volution mais c'est toujours marrant et Ã§a se joue vite, une petite partie de 5 minutes par ci par la pourquoi pas.

Assolutamente divertente!! 

Siete un contadino e dovrete sparare alle orde di vacche e zombie, e vacche-zombie che cercaranno di venirvi addosso ed entrare nel vostro fienile.
Il gioco Ã¨ semplice, un po' stupido, ma davvero simpatico.
Non vale i 10â‚¬ che chiedono, ma durante i saldi si trova ad un prezzo assolutamente abbordabile, per il quale dovrete assolutamente averlo in libreria!

review: Es un buen juego, bastante corto y monotono pero bastante entretenido, tiene unas buenas graficas y una interfaz retro, una jugabilidad sencilla y un OST memorable y bien colocado. En si el juego es muy bizarro y es lo que le da su escencia, cuenta con cromos y 5 logros intersantes, lo recomiendo para comprar en una oferta o si lo consigues gratis por alguna pagina de internet donde regalen indies mejor, le doy un 7.50/10.

[h1] Achievements [/h1] Es gibt insgesamt 5 Erfolge. Diese gibt es fÃ¼rs beenden des Tutorials, fÃ¼rs Upgraden von Waffen & Munition, durchs einsetzen eienr FÃ¤higkeit und fÃ¼rs beseigen des UFOs

[h1] Pro/Contra [/h1]
+ Cooles Gameplay

author: {'steamid': '76561198035809754', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1468462980}
review:
One of the worst games I've ever played. I can't remember how much money I must have spent on it, but even if you get it for free it's absolutely not worth it.

Controls are rubbish, they cannot be changed.

Item upgrades have no description anywhere, so you just have to guess.

The hit detection is worse than the Holocaust.

You can have power-ups or credits dropped from the sky but, again, nobody tells you that this function exists, or what each one does.

There are cheat codes but they must be entered while you're fighting. You die before you can finish typing.

The content is tiny, very badly done.

The voice acting is one of the worst I've ever seen. And I'm not comparing it to AAA games. No. I mean this is terrible, beyond comparison. If a deaf person heard this game after getting their hearing back, they'd kill the surgeon.

The music lasts 20 seconds and loops infintely, burning your brains out.

There are only 5 achievements and they only require you to press a button. Stupider than Jayden Smith.

It is a very poor copy of Plants vs Zombies, where you have to protect your farm (instead of house) from zombie cows AND normal zombies. But instead of having a strategy you have to remember what 12 different keys do, but also pay attention to how much money you have, otherwise you cannot press them. Plus, some have cooldowns! All of this while you're moving around the map with WASD.

Oh, by the way, you have to reload constantly, but reloading takes LONGER than enemies to kill you. And this is not explained anywhere, either.

It seems it's going to be a joke about rednecks, but it feels like it was made by rednecks instead.

It's not even bloody enough. It feels worse than those flash games from 1997 which took 10 hours to load and then had less features than Pong. Worse than those PowerPoint chain emails they send you, which after 10 minutes of loading and scrolling through endless mail addresses, are not even funny.

At first I thought I should be supportive of an indie game. Maybe they haven't got a clue how to make a game, or they just don't have the team. But I've seen Audiosurf come out of ONE person's work. And it's brilliant. You can't get more indie than Grezzo 2, and it's hilarious. If you want badly-done-on-purpose, there is Goat Simulator. Even Garry's Mod. This is just vomitive. Especially when you consider it's 9 pounds. 9 POUNDS! Which is around 13-15 dollars. For this!!

And no. I don't write reviews lightly. I usually play for at least 20 hours before thinking I can give my opinion (feel free to check my other reviews). But honestly, after 5 minutes, there is nothing else to be seen.

I just spent the following 40 minutes trying to get the last achievement.

I'm really sorry, but for the first time ever, I'm going to award a game a negative score. -1/10 Run. Far.

review:
So, it's a game if you want to have fun for a while, but it's very repititive.
You kill cows, spend money upgrading weapon and bullets on each level, new opponents are unlocked as you advance in levels, but it's always the same.
Beated the game in 3.6 hours. Something you could play on the browser.
Got it for free. Wouldn't spend 11â‚¬ to have it... not even 1â‚¬.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103644100', 'num_games_owned': 186, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1420498666}
review: Simple per divertido el juego ed pobre de todo pero si que es buen pasa tiempo es bastante entrete por un rato sinceramente yo jugue mas de lo necesario para obtener los cromos

author: {'steamid': '76561198139057960', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1467069432}
review:
Great game 10/10 would play again IGN

The graphics are just insane to be honest couldn't ask for more.
Context of the game is on point and the cows scare the crap out of you if you look at them dodgy.
The 'cows' are going mad and you need to put a stop to it. I would recommend this game to everyone out there looking for a new game to love and cherish.

This is a new development in technology and I feel that they should maybe take it up a notch and add a virtual reality feature.

Thanks again for the good memories, love your game <3

review:
Nothing about the game is special. Only fun u can get is kill stuff.

It feels like just flash game quality, those u can just play on your browser.

The game is not hard (for me), as u can see in my game record, I used only 4.3 hours.

Will I replay it?
Nope. At least not in a long long time.

3/10 I will only recommend this game (In sale) to those who really want to spend their extra bucks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022087448', 'num_games_owned': 606, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1465066849}
review:
It's a game about quick reaction, perfect execution and good split second decisions. 
In the zombie apocalypse, you play a farmer who protects his shed from zombie cows.
It's essentially a wave defense game where you have 1 HP and have to juggle upgrades, cooldowns, ammo etc.
The execution of the game is shabby but not crappy.
Still I'd rather be playing something like OFDP than this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100992838', 'num_games_owned': 747, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1465874765}
review:
This game represents an interesting idea executed very poorly.
No permanent upgrades, few upgrades and enemy variety, few levels, unmemorable soundtrack.
The enemies don't disappear after being killed. It is ok when you are dealing with 20 or 30 of them, but on later stages, and mainly on the granade launcher one, this is an absurd hindrance, smaller enemies will hide behind the corpses of bigger enemies and you won't see them until it is too late.
This game is ok for 15 minutes, and then it just isn't anymore. You will get 4 of the achievements in 15 minutes and then have to make your way through to the last stage to get the last one and it sincerely isn't really worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971332981', 'num_games_owned': 821, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 548, 'last_played': 1417235402}

author: {'steamid': '76561198048865581', 'num_games_owned': 2546, 'num_reviews': 242, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1472476709}
review:
The Culling Of The Cows is a lane defense game.
The review will be presented in a simplistic "Pros/Neutral/Cons" format.
Pros:
* Given away on some free giveaways, so keep an eye out for that.
* Simplistic graphics, can be run on anything.
* Cow corpses stay there until the end of the mission. (Trust me, it's quite good)
* 4 of the 5 achievements can be obtained in the first 30-45 minutes.
* No need to focus on the game.
* Skills and upgrades.

Neutral:
* Hard to tell the live cows from the dead ones later on... (Technically realism?).

Cons:
* Last achievement can be obtained in the end of the game, probably about 6-8 hours in the game.
* The difficulty curve is just too harsh.
* The hitboxes are a bit screwy, I'd suggest shooting slightly above the cow to hit. 

Overall:
5/10 (Barely recommended)
If I had to pay for this, it'd be 3.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198164306900', 'num_games_owned': 4401, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 478, 'last_played': 1462940825}
review:
Kill zombie Cows, Trample over there dead bodies as they continue to pile up, 
Take down the Nazi Zombie Regime, Cow-abunga.

First off I didnt pay 12.99 for it, and I think that is a lot.
However this game was very fun.
Its like a tower defence game in a way. except your just defending 1 base, against different kinds of attackers.
The game has lots of upgrades and a decent amount of levels, my biggest gripe was it freezing after beating the last boss.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018453161', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1462744412}
review:
What a waste of time..

I've got this game as part of a 10 key bundle, and this was my "premium" game (price wise).
This game is an utter joke.

At first I liked the music - A bit 16bit'ish with some nice distortion.
It quickly irked me once I realised the distorted sounds where allover the place.
And once you get further into the game, the charm of the sad and ugly graphics quickly turns for the worse.
The more enemies you kill, the more garbage fills your screen.
No explanation of the different ammo types or upgrades, and the stupid assist constantly changes slots. Also, it never mentions that your own "assist" can kill you >.<

At least you're able to mute the game, make it windowed and idle while doing other stuff (= getting the 5 free cards).

If you got this game as I did (i.e: No refund option) and you want the stupid free cards (and easy 100% achievement) follow the neat guides.
One, by the developer, tells you how to open the cheat menu (I could NOT figure out how to do it) but also list all the cheats.
One opens up all the worlds - BOOM. Go to last level, use the guide which tells you how to skip the first two sectors and BOOM! Achievement done in less hours than I have spent.

*sigh* I can't believe it took me 3hours of grinding before I finally "cheated" and went looking at the guides.
Save yourselves some time, and just blatantly "cheat" through the achievements.

Very bad game.
Very bad price tag.
I sincerly hope you didn't buy this game by your own choice.

Having a boner and no arms > This game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072051459', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1462609752}

author: {'steamid': '76561198017225560', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1461517908}
review:
Eine Mischung aus Sidescroller und Tower Defense?
Klang vorerst interessant, dazu die TD Ã¼blichen MÃ¶glichkeiten zum Upgraden, langsam steigender Schwierigkeitsgrad und unterschiedliche Gegner.

Die Grafik ist im Comiclook gehalten, wirkt alles in allem aber sehr billig.

Das Gameplay ist schnell erlernt und relativ simpel gehalten, man kommt schnell dahinter, was die effektivste Taktik ist, dann wird das Spiel auch sehr schnell monoton, denn viel mehr hat das Spiel nicht zu bieten.

Zu dem Preis auf keinen Fall eine Empfehlung, hÃ¶chstens fÃ¼r 1/10 des Preises und selbst da wÃ¼rde ich es mir 2x Ã¼berlegen.

Vergleichbare Spiele gibt es auf diversen Seiten als Flashgame fÃ¼r lau.

3/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198064073403', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1461564819}
review:
So, here I go. Everyone likes a good tower defense game and what better to have than zombies in it. Not just any zombie, but cows... freaking COWS! 

The game is pretty straight forward. You move and shoot. And shoot like your life depended on it. As a matter of fact, it does. You get your various ammo upgrades and some other upgrades to help you manage those incoming zekes. But, heres the best part. You get assists, ranging from 1 to 4, based on which stage you are on. You just shoot, reload and shoot some more.

So, I highly recommend that you buy this game(wait for the sale though). And you kill some zombies and the odd badger or two. Goodluck.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141602674', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1430575743}
review:
The Culling Of The Cows is a side-scrolling shooter / tower defence game. You will take the role of Sammy, a soliloquizing schizophrenic farmer with a self prophesied mission to lay waste to the disease spreading over his farm. 

With his dusty old 12 gauge at his side and god at his back, Sammy isnâ€™t going to be taking too kindly to the infectious chaos of the big cityâ€™s leaking its way out into wild country. When all the lunacy started Sammy consulted God on what he should do, and the response was. KILL THEM! KILL THEM ALL!!!!
Steam Big Picture
Features:
Full Controller support. 
Steam Achievements. 
Fast paced action mixed with strategic gameplay. 
40 levels of critters that need a good butchering. 
Cheat Console. 
Plough your way through herds of shamblers and ravenous cattle. 
Easy to pick up and play, but gets quite challenging.
My rating 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000704094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1433905127}
review: I, like others, got this game for free and am relieved I didn't pay a penny for it. While the visuals are amusing, and the story should make it a shoe-in for satire and over-the-top comedy, it's just dull. The nail in the coffin, however, is the controls: they're clunky, uninspired, and death happens often because one is fighting against combat and evasion. Hats off to those who put hours into the game; I only put in 26 minutes and uninstalled it afterwards. It's a cute game, but if it means paying money for it, I recommend giving it a pass. Even for free, there's better out there.

review: The game is alright, nor is it horrible, nor is it unplayable. The game follows a farmer who tries to protect his barn/farm from the diseased alien cows and human zombies. The game is like a tower defense game, where you play the farmer shooting your way through hordes of cows, with a little variety here and there. The concept is okay but can get a little repetitious at certain parts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132780522', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1452634454}
review:
* Game Key Obtained from a Giveaway

If anything this game is going to be a hit and miss affair with you, as it did with me. The game is essentially a defence title, with an assortment of monsters rushing into the barn, and as the farmer it is your job to prevent the said monstrosities from getting in. If you fail a certain number of times, the stage is over and you have to restart again.

To mix up the formula some monsters act a little different to one another, along with varying amounts of hit points. To aid the chaotic game play, players can also summon a few tactical skills on the field, along with some limited and temporary upgrades to the shotgun.

Repeat the same formula with increasing difficulties for dozens of stages and you get the general idea of how this goes. Every rarely youâ€™ll get to fight a boss or two, but theyâ€™re way too simple to pose a challenge.

The art style is hand drawn and mostly consistent, like the game play that may not strike everyoneâ€™s fancy either, but it sat well enough for me. The biggest problem I had with the game was that it lacked a sense of progression, youâ€™ll upgrade your weapon level after level, but they never stick. There is also little point to divert from the main path and complete every stage, since there is nothing to unlock or to accomplish.

For the low price though, I would recommend it for a decent distraction.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088128193', 'num_games_owned': 379, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1441847509}
review:
4/5 because i glitched out a couple of times.

You play as a farmer, protecting his farm from zombie cows, zombie honey badgers, and feminists. You can upgrade your gun with different ammo and upgrades with cash you get at the beginning of each round, as well as any airdrops you might grab. God powers are handy for when you know you fucked up. Engaging game, get it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998548966', 'num_games_owned': 2244, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1457435572}
review:
A fun game where you defend your farm against raging zombie cows and hippies.

+ The gameplay is fun, the different ammo types requires you to adapt your game style
+ The game is quite short (this is a pro for me)
+ The visuals are good enough for a game of this kind

- The gameplay gets a little repetitive towards the end. You get to see eveything the game offers in he first few missions.
- There is no checkpoint system, so you turn back to the beginning of the mission at the smallest mistake.

I'd recommend this game to those who want to do fill their short free time periods.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032370068', 'num_games_owned': 4906, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1455199648}
review:
I grabbed this one for free when they used to give it away on most websites.Game isn't too bad, you just defend the farm by killing cows, much like plants vs zombies only that the plants is just a farmer and the zombies are mad cows.

A few upgrades and unlocks, a few unlockable enemies, and that's about it.

It's worth giving it a shot, if you don't hate it straght away it can be completed in 2 hours or less, there's cheat codes which makes it a lot easier to unlock all the levels.

The last boss can be a bit tricky, but it's pretty easy in the end.
5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198054982103', 'num_games_owned': 1994, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 1158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1108, 'last_played': 1454512835}
review: What can I say about Culling Of The Cows... Well, I can't really say I enjoyed all 19 hours of this strangely addicting, but rage inducing game, but the majority of those hours were spent grinding 41 levels, countless stages, suicide cows, and other strange, killable... things... Overall it took 19 hours of blood, ( I actually cut my hand punching a wall in pure hatred of this game ) sweat and tears, which also almost happened, to complete 41 game levels, earning all 87 gold metals for the majority of those 41 levels and all 5 achievements. Decent game, simple, left to right shooter, easy to get to grips with, the only downfall is that the shooting isnt always too accurate, which is where the frustrations come into it. 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198003019731', 'num_games_owned': 1879, 'num_reviews': 368, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1453073991}
review:
O jogo The Culling of the Cows foi alvo de piadas ao ser oferecido de graÃ§a pelo Indie Gala por um tempo. Um longo tempo. Eles tinham 250 mil chaves para despachar e, aparentemente, nÃ£o existem 250 pessoas no mundo interessadas no jogo, quem dirÃ¡ 250 mil. Semanas se passaram. Que viraram meses. AtÃ© o Indie Gala se tocar que era melhor remover a promoÃ§Ã£o do ar.

Ã‰ claro que eu peguei uma chave para mim. Ã‰ claro que o jogo nÃ£o vale o preÃ§o.

The Culling of the Cows Ã© um tÃ­tulo sobre zumbis, mais especificamente vacas zumbis. No papel de um fazendeiro e sua indefectÃ­vel espingarda, vocÃª enfrenta onda apÃ³s onda de bovinos mortos-vivos sedentos de sangue.

Os grÃ¡ficos nÃ£o chegam a comprometer a experiÃªncia e usam e abusam de podreiras para vender seu peixe, no caso, suas vacas. Mutantes. Zumbis. NÃ£o Ã© muito claro, mas visualmente o jogo funciona como uma versÃ£o animada daqueles quadrinhos podreiras que as editoras alternativas americanas produzem aos borbotÃµes. Tosco, mas adequado Ã  atmosfera.

Entretanto, o pecado fatal de The Culling of the Cows Ã© tentar se vender como um Tower Defense, quando, na verdade, Ã© um jogo de tiro bem arcade, onde Ã© muito mais importante movimentar o fazendeiro e atirar na hora certa do que exatamente posicionar qualquer elemento no mapa. Agilidade e presteza no gatilho dÃ£o a tÃ´nica em uma jogaibilidade simplÃ³ria que enjoa rÃ¡pido. Com 27 minutos de jogatina, jÃ¡ tinha destravado 4 dos 5 achievements disponÃ­veis.

Na primeira fase, vocÃª sÃ³ enfrenta um tipo de vaca. Na segunda fase, entra em cena uma vaca mais rÃ¡pida. Na terceira fase, surpresa!, Ã© introduzida uma vaca mais rÃ¡pida ainda. Criatividade passa longe e acredito que a Ãºnica mudanÃ§a no visual dos pobres bovinos Ã© a cor do sprite.

The Culling of the Cows Ã© o tÃ­pico jogo que nasceu na plataforma ou na Ã©poca errada. Faria sucesso em sites de jogos de Flash e um port para dispositivos mÃ³veis poderia melhorar sensivelmente a conta bancÃ¡ria do seu desenvolvedor, com anÃºncios e customizaÃ§Ãµes para o fazendeiro. Talvez, nesses casos, ele encontrasse seu pÃºblico. Como estÃ¡, eu e o Indie Gala aprendemos a duras penas que nem de graÃ§a vale o seu tempo.

Originalmente publicado em: http://blog.retinadesgastada.com.br/2016/01/nao-jogando-culling-of-cows.html

author: {'steamid': '76561198027096691', 'num_games_owned': 664, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1453309581}
review:
[b]TL;DR review at the bottom![/b]

The Culling of the Cows is a wave/horde zombie shooter with no content at all. There are 2 "gamemodes" you either control a guy running up-down and left-right while shooting, upgrading your weapon, or bring in assist abilities, or its a simple turret shooter. Number of maps: 1. Yes, only 1 map for a zombie defense game. The only difference between the levels are the assist abilities which. There are around 10 types of enemies, most of them basicly the same: cow, a bit faster cow, a bit tougher cow, ect. Controls are clunky. In the main gamemode you can't aim, you have to move your character in the line where you want to shoot. The hitbox are buggy as hell, bullets often go through the target without damaging them. Finishing the game takes around 2 hours, highly repetitive and there is no co-op. The game also highly overpriced (there are much better flash games in this genre for free). If you'd like to buy a zombie defense game which is cheaper, simple but has co-op and runs on a microwave go with the Yet Another Zombie Defense. It's only 2â‚¬ and essentially has the same, but cheaper and has coop (also frequently updated).

TL;DR:
Just don't buy this.
It's boring, has zero content, repetitive.

review: Repetitive, uninspired, shoot the waves until they're done, then do it again. Fun for about three levels, then you're doing the same thing over, and over, and over again, until you get to the end. author: {'steamid': '76561198000402354', 'num_games_owned': 1050, 'num_reviews': 240, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1452547165}
review:
You kill cows ... thats it. 

You have a shotgun and 4 ammo types. First one is regular and is unlimited. Other 3 have to be bought.
You can reload one bullet at a time. 8 bullets is max. Prepare for mashing the R button.

God can drop you supply drops with buffs or coins. You can use coins to buy ammo or upgrades for your shotgun.

You also have 4 abilities with cooldown. 

There are 10 types of enemies (mostly cows).

Enemies come in waves and want to kill you.

One background image for each level - mostly static.

Can't recommend this. It's boring.

review:
As others have said, this game feels and plays like a cheap, uninspired flash game. I really don't understand why it has 75% positive reviews; gameplay gets stale by the third level, art is awkward and tacky, main character is the embodiment of stinky Texan redneck stereotypes... I've put 3.3 hours into it, completed 100%, achievements included. 

Got it for free and I tell you I'd be angry if I had paid for it. Avoid.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017117138', 'num_games_owned': 619, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1451947828}
review:
Damn this thing is awful. Got if as a "surprise" key in a key shop.

Seriously, I had more fun with the various tower defense flash games (which are free btw.).

This game is repetitive and gets boring reaaally quick (yes even for a tower defense game) and lacks of proper controls.
Everyone that has no QWERTY keyboard already has a downside because the button layout is not customizable. 
Seriously, developers, f-ing seriously? 

About the "arcade charme". Yes, maybe the arcade charme of a terrible old tower defense game. But most games in the past had better controls, more percise aiming and didn't look like a storybook drawn by a crack addict.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036063422', 'num_games_owned': 802, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 402, 'last_played': 1451774397}
review:
Fun to play an almost mindless arcade shooter, where you are a redneck who defends his farm against the undead - animals and post-humans too.
The carnage is pretty straight forward, and will take 4-5 hours to complete.Never buy in full price, but around a dollar it is to played in the hours you can't play any brain activity demanding game.
Shoot to thrill.

author: {'steamid': '76561198242435838', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1457284662}
review:
Great fun game! A defence 2d shooter, where you play as a jewish farmer defending your farm from zombified cows that run madly at you to eat up your soul, coming from some unknown source. Having quite a bit of fun so far, pretty hard tho, i reccomend using a controller for the sidescrolling levels and a mouse for the infinite ammo roof shooting levels for best confort. The level progression is really good, it does really get harder as you go along, but mot so much, the final boss is quite tough, and guess who you fight? A jews worst enemy: Nazi UFO! It was the nazi's new plan to exterminate you, using cows instead of camps, fukin brilliant! I really enjoyed playing this game, the upgrades are intuitive however if u wanna get 100% you will have to refrain from upgrading substancailly increasing the games difficulty!

Edit: I managed to beat the final boss: Nazi UFO, the first part needs to be carefully planned out then u rely on reflex and improvisation! Overall around 6 or so hours of gameplay...

About people saying it feels like a cheap flash game, well maybe, but what the game is in doesnt affect the game itself much, there are other factors, hovever unlike a browser flash game, as i mentioned before, there is gamepad support which makes the games so much better for waves levels, as reloading on the keybard is a pain in the ass, but also hi res full screen support, which no flash games have, maybe unity but not cheap flash, flash is almost obselete btw, i do however feel like 9 quid is wayy too much for this game, max 3 quid i would say, for me it has a kind of retro 2d style of graphics like in games like golden axe, except HD textures, the farmer looks hillarious BTW, really used all the jewish steroetypes like a fukin massive nose!

The game may not be impressive from a technical standpoint, but it sure is fun to play, which is what counts for me, and more importantly, it runs on my shitty PC!! 60 FUKIN FPS aswell, great for weak computers, proving that old computers still get ocasional fun games for them, you basically have the retro games older than 2005 (10 years old) and the un-demanding moders ones, not sure when this game came out, but im assuming newer than 2010.

Do i reccomend buying this game at full price? Definitely no! Look for steam offers and givaway sites if u want to play this game, probably loads of poeple have steam keys for this game from past givaways, so look to buy or trade it off them for dirt cheap.


8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198074734359', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1448232692}
review:
[h1] The Culling of the Cows [/h1]

The Culing of the Cows, in many instances, feels like a browser game you can play for free when you're bored and have nothing else installed. 

Graphics aren't the best, mechanics are annoyingly unpolished, diversity is inexistent... The overall game, to be honest, could've been improved a lot before being released. With that being said, however, it's still a fun - but short - experience. 

Don't expect much from it and you might have a pleasant time playing it. If you're willing to give it a try, I'd wait for a generous discount(Summer/Winter Sale), considering the price it charges isn't simply what it's worth. Additionally, many Bundles give it for free from time to time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049809881', 'num_games_owned': 470, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1485279656}
review:
I got this game for free from a giveaway.The rules are simple.Protect your farm from the evil alien zombie cows and other creatures.You stand with your shotgun in front of your farm and you kill waves of different creatures.That's all.It's a boring game with no story and the only reason that i played it is because it was free.There are better tower defense games out there to play.

Graphics: 3/10
Gameplay: 4/10
Music: 2/10
Story: 1/10
Level Design: 4/10
Overall: 3/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198107795150', 'num_games_owned': 464, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1451598978}
review:
I have fun playing this game, laughing and smiling all the time actually even I suck and have to replay a level a lots, the graphic is cool, sounds are good; plus I get this game for free. But, I would not recommend it for these following reasons:

- Game have "full controller support" but you can't even config control option. So is not playable for people use AZERTY keyboard. Plus, you have to press R for reloading every single bullet and it will made your index finger tired between moving to D and rapidly pressing R after a while (if it can change to Space button would be nice, but dev gave a middlepinger right in our face).

- Until now, I still don't now what Z,X and C upgrade for (all I now is V get you laser for better aim)? No intruction as far as I remember, too (or I've skipped it, I means ain't nobody got time for that). Hover your mouse on it to show what it do is a basic thing that all game need. 

- Talks about mouse, because you aim by moving, so dev should make it keybroad only (for laptop users), or you know, a FUCKING config control option. By made this keyboard and mouse, your left hand have to handle so much things (moving, reloading every fucking single bullet, upgrade, call supply, change bullet type) while all your right hand do is right click to shoot (left click to alt-fire but you can only do it when using first type of bullet, and you move so slow which means you gonna stick near your base, far from those cow, which means it's useless for 99% of the time).

==> Conclusion: There are better flash games out there and they're free. Don't buy this game even 90% off, wait and find free key online. Only buy as gift to piss off your Curry friends (which I wouldn't recommend, too).

author: {'steamid': '76561197998785996', 'num_games_owned': 1958, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1451454346}
review:
Quick Summary â€“ An (almost) casual wave shooter game with simplified mechanics. This is just like one of those browser games that you can find on Newgrounds or Kongregate that you can play for an hour or two at a time. Give it a try if you like that sort of thing, itâ€™s a small download size.

You play an old dude with a shotgun defending your farm against (zombie?) cows charging at you on a small 3D field.  You can move up down and side to side but the screen doesnâ€™t scroll. The zombie cows of various speeds and toughness will run from right to left toward you and you need to blast them before they get into the barn youâ€™re guarding on the left side of the screen. To help you on your task, you can purchase gun upgrades and different types of ammo (buckshot, exploding, etc.) in each level, or use â€œassistsâ€ such as sentry guns or firewalls that are free but on cooldown timers.

Pros:
+Simple gameplay that can occupy you maybe 30 minutes at a time when you have nothing better to do. Each level is maybe 5-10 minutes long and not too hard once you get the hang of it.
+There are some humor elements to the game so even though each level is mostly the same, you can get a couple laughs.

Cons:
-There are maybe 50 levels of the same gameplay and you may get bored pretty quick.

Overall the game is fun for a short time and if youâ€™re like me, youâ€™ll probably be done with it after getting the easy Steam achievements. Play it and forget it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082837621', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1600690184}
review:
EntrÃ© a darle un buen anÃ¡lisis al juego pensando que lo tendrian cagado a negativos... Pero no. Y me alegro.
El juego es de esos que al verlo por primera vez no le tienes ni un poco de fe... Pero tras jugarlo unos 5 minutos te das cuenta que es bueno y que en verdad esos 5 minutos fueron mÃ¡s de 2 horas de corrido. El juego es corto... SÃ­, pero se disfruta bastante, yo lo obtuve gratis por suerte, pero les digo enserio que estando en oferta (donde vivo cuesta menos de mil pesos, Chile) vale la pena comprarlo porque en verdad es un pepino de juego, sencillo, pero un pepino muy adictivo.

Un "arcade" para pasar el rato, casual, muy casual... 

No hablare ni de historia ni de banda sonora, jugabilidad ni nada... Es un juego sencillo como ya he dicho pero enserio, es muy bueno

ValoraciÃ³n: pepino/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198013017981', 'num_games_owned': 788, 'num_reviews': 518, 'playtime_forever': 223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1451346488}
review:
Un juego arcade de la pesadilla de cualquier granjero, gordas satanicas y vacas zombies con alien nazis (probablemente zombies), con graficos y animaciones de un juego del aÃ±o 2004, y un soundtrack a lo devil may cry, varias formas de morir que pueden asustar a cualquier madre que no recuerda lo que hacia en su juventud, dura 3 horas si lo queres terminar con el logro 5 horas si queres complear todos los levels, y si queres hacer todos los levels con todas las medallas (pasar un nivel sin mejorar armas).. mejor matate nunca lograras por sus controles, y tiene pocos logros y faciles (25 minutos 4 de los 5 logros) con unos controles que podrian molestar en muchos casos gracias a que el personaje muere de un golpe, el juego lo regalan o lo ponen a 1.30$ tiene algunos cromos y ya les digo, los logros tendrian que haberles puesto mas, como matar al oso,

Lo recomiendo pero si lo encuentran en una oferta a menos de 2 dolares o si lo consigen regalado, por precio completo, oh dios no!

Lo habia visto en greenlight anteriomente, asi que no se quejen ahora que lo pusieron en steam...


EDIT: El juego tiene una opcion de extras que no sirve, ya me lo pase y no me deja entrar...

author: {'steamid': '76561198037520882', 'num_games_owned': 695, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1450332731}
review:
It wasn't as fun as it looked. I give up rather quickly with these types of games if I don't advance quickly, which was exactly what happened here. I think my biggest issue was how hard it was to hit something on the same row as you. I often thought I nailed a shot just to have it miss. It's not to bad, but I rather play something else for half an hour. 

5/10 Repetitive and boring with sucky hit detection. Some will find this appealing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046632936', 'num_games_owned': 1078, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1474120845}
review:
Okay so here is my story
1. Got this game for free
2. Saw 5 achievements to be achieved
3. Look at the space required 64MB wohooo (it took me about 15 minutes only)
4. Launched the game
5. Tried the weapon and IT IS FILLED WITH UNLIMITED BULLLLLETSSSS YAYYY
6. Broke the tutorial
7. Got into first quest
8. When I reached wave 2, got r4ped by some black cows because forgot to reload
9. Tried again and ended up the same ending
10. Rating time: 11/10 would like to play again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017843065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 492, 'last_played': 1449446941}
review:
Simple, short indie shooter.

I feel Â£9 it is a bit pricey considering how short and simple the game is, thankful that I got mine in one of the eight bundles it has so far appeared in. This perhaps irks me the most, had it been Â£1 game I may have been more forgiving.
The graphics are overlaid single scenes, nothing special, new or particularly interesting. Sound okay though I ended up muting after a while. Weapons, upgrades etc. seemed superfluous to me as the game is easy enough without.
Achievements super easy and drop with progress.
For me the replay value is 0.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020624029', 'num_games_owned': 654, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1449443515}
review:
Spanish and English Review

Steam award nomination "Best Use Of A Farm Animal"

A game about killing zombie cows. What do I think? Well is a excellent game for killing time; is difficult to adapt to the game but as you play more and more it become a piece of cake. I recommend this for killing time and when you have no titles to play. 

Un juego de matar vacas zombies. Â¿QuÃ© pienso? Bueno es un excelente juego para matar el tiempo; Es difÃ­cil adaptarse al juego, pero a medida que juegas cada vez mÃ¡s se hace muy facil. Recomiendo este juego para matar el tiempo y cuando no tengas tÃ­tulos para jugar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077167910', 'num_games_owned': 572, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1449301261}
review:
In this side-scrolling barn defence game, you play as a farmer trying to keep a horde of monstrous cattle at bay.

The art style is a mishmash of what seems to be unique assets and clip art/open source materials, the audio is low quality and grating, the controls are not very precise, and the game is repetitive and boring.

It feels like a horrible port of a horrible mobile game. I got this for free, yet still feel ripped off.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002552093', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1448728191}
review:
Gioco con grafico retrÃ².
GiÃ  dall'inizio, per la primissima volta in questo gioco, il videogiocatore viene catapultato in un gioco dove le tematiche appaiono assai scontate e banali: spostati con  W-A-S-D e con il destro del mouse spara. C'Ã¨ da sottolineare che si spara SOLO in direziona avanti e indietro, Niente a che fare con un FPS o giochi simili. Dal primo tutorial si percepisce un gioco fatto veloce, e fatto male. Mucche zombie che tentano di arrivare al fienile e se incontrano l'agricoltore, quest'ultimo viene scaraventato a terra e fatto in mille pezzi dalle mucche. Per difendersi bisogna comprare armi/potenziamenti e solite cose giÃ  viste. La grafica lascia decisamente a desiderare. la difficoltÃ  Ã¨ soggettiva ma il tutto viene condito con la possibilitÃ  di usufruire di potenziamenti solo dopo tot tempo. L'uccisione delle mucche non porta niente, nessun plus, nessun punto extra, niente. Lo scopo del gioco Ã¨ di ammazzare le mucche zombie... clichÃ© visto in ogni salsa.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967419832', 'num_games_owned': 1365, 'num_reviews': 193, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1448531238}
review:
It's surprisingly fun, Culling of the Cows. Barn on the left, Zombies come from the right, kill them before they get to the barn. Survive multiple waves to beat the level, but be careful, since if the Zombies touch/hit you, you will die instantly. To compare it to another game, its a lot like the "The Last Stand" Flash game, and I'm talking about the [i]first[/i] 'The Last Stand'. Also one of the more difficult parts about shooting is that you can only shoot strait ahead of your character, as in you can't use the mouse to angle his gun to the upper/lower rows.

Other than the basic shooting, with your Shotgun, there are 4 other aspects in fighting.
[list]
[*] [b]Ammo -[/b] There are 4 ammo types: Normal, Buckshot, Piercing, and Explosive. You need to pay for these.

[*] [b]Supply Drop -[/b] When you press the Supply Drop button, a crate will fall from the air, a delivery strait from God(seriously). It can contain various temporary powerups like 10 second invincibility, Unlimited Ammo(10sec), or even basic Cash Drops. When a Drop is called, the ability is placed on cooldown, and can be pressed again when it goes off the cooldown. This is free to use.

[*] [b]Assists -[/b] This is where God himself, I'm serious here, helps you out. Like placing a giant saw in front of your barn door to kill advancing zombies, or a turret that randomly shoots, or a wall of fire in the middle of the screen. They are brief, like 10 seconds or something, and go on a cooldown after used, but they're useful. These are Free to use.

[*] [b]Upgrades -[/b] These are 4 simple upgrades for your Shotgun, they are: Clip Size, Reload Speed, Shoot Speed, and a Laser Pointer. You need to pay for these.
[/list]

Each level you start out with a certain amount of cash. These can be used on the Ammo or Upgrades. You can get more cash from Supply Drops. The higher the level, the more you start with. And for the record, Ammo and Upgrades to not transfer to other levels.

I definitely recommend this game to anyone who enjoyed The Last Stand, or anyone who likes this type of game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067004017', 'num_games_owned': 495, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1452667026}
review:
The Culling of the Cows is a game about a redneck farmer going crazy from bad moonshine and starting to shoot the livestock around the place, hallucinating them to be zombies. Further hallucinations include, but are not limited to, a Nazi UFO.

10/10 would shoot the drooling bastards again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135029846', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1452052328}
review: Es un excelente juego, su tematica postapocalÃ­ptica una horda de vacas zombies intentando infiltrar tu rancho al mejor estilo del viejo sur protegerlo a toda costa, bastante bueno 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198030705477', 'num_games_owned': 661, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1448066049}
review:
Crappy graphics (they should've gone to retro style instead), jerky animation, repetitive gameplay but somewhat strangely good. Think of it like the classic Crimsonland, but the enemies only come from the right side of the screen. It's hard to hit the cows, but when you do, it feels satisfying. Great for short burst of fun. 

I'm not sure about the later levels since I haven't spent too much time on it, but I can see it can become very chaotic.

I got it for free. Do I recommend a purchase of this game? Yes, but only in discount and if you don't have any other games to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132095481', 'num_games_owned': 294, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1470369110}
review: Es un juego genial el cual voy a jugar por un rato y mantener en mi biblioteca, vale la pena comprarlopues la idea esta bien, pero el granjerillo en muy lentillo y el hecho de que te muevas con la crecueta (en control de xbox) esta un poco incomodo, lo unico genial seria que estubiera disponible el poder moverse con el stick. Probablemente sea mas comodo jugar con teclado debido a la lentitud del granjero y a la precision que se necesita.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038967349', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1447363629}
review:
I've just cleared "The Culling Of The Cows" and before you read any further, I will tell you, it's an okay game, but I wouldn't buy it myself (I got it in a gift :))

The game is about a farmer, who needs to clear his way through sick cows and fat goths. And by clearing, I mean shooting everything and everyone in his way. In the end you even get to kill a mtherf*cking Nazi Ufo, so that's kinda cool.
But the game takes about 3-4 hours to clear, maybe less and it's kinda easy once you get into it. I started bored and kinda scared of the dead cows running towards me. But once I got the upgrades and the "help" it got more and more "brutal" but also intresting. The ending does kinda suck, but that doesn't play a big role..

So If you like to shoot, old-school graphics/retro and zombies, I guess it's something worth.
I would rate it.. 5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025095151', 'num_games_owned': 1052, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1445560044}
review:
You defend your barn from Zombie cows, fat ex girflriends, and other crazy ... things?  I don't feel like I can recommend the game.  The game isn't bad, but the price tag is way to high for what you get.

Pros:
Good humor
Final boss is a Nazi UFO
Challenging
Tons of levels

Cons:
Feels like a flash game
Really hard to play with a controller.
Not the best bang for your buck

author: {'steamid': '76561198140044816', 'num_games_owned': 1238, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1447153154}
review:
A very simplistic side-scrolling survival game. It's really fun and perfect for when you want to kill some time. Some of the levels can be more than challenging but you have the choice to let "God" assist you in different ways; also, there are cheat codes provided by the game developers, if that's something you're into ;)

The achievements are fairly easy to achieve, although to get the very last one you need to complete the whole game.

According to me, it's not worth â‚¬11 (current price), so I advise you to get it during a sale!

Rednecks > cows

author: {'steamid': '76561197967069225', 'num_games_owned': 1513, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1452984854}
review:
Apparently I got this for free at some point along the way, or maybe as part of a humble bundle or similar. 
I like the part where they don't claim the farmer suffers from mental illness and uses it as an excuse for violent behaviour </sarcasm> (despite the fact that people with mental illnesses are more likely to be *victims* of violence, than perpetrators.)

Maybe it has good gameplay. Maybe the steam trading cards will be worth installing this thing and running in the background for a couple hours. 
But this is not the sort of game I would want to buy, and I cannot in good conscience recommend it in any way whatsoever. 

(Edit: Turns out I need to have run it for at least 5mins to post a review. So...)


- Arrow keys (up, down, etc) don't work on main menu screen. Had to rely on controller/mouse to go down to the options screen.
- On a fresh install 'Continue' is what you have to click in order to begin, rather than 'New Game'. A minor annoyance, but a very simple thing that should have been in the game.
- Tutorial failed to inform me that I could shoot backwards, and skips forward to the next tip if you accidentally press A rather than showing the hint text first, even if you've never run the game before. 
Got insta-killed three times trying to do the first level because I was attempting to move back far enough to protect the barn from cows that managed to run past me, and found out accidentally when trying to select a different action bar option.
- Spelling error on the text for the very first level after the tutorial. "Surly" this could have been fixed before release, or in any of the 3 updates during the year and a half since it appeared on Steam.

This could have been a good game, and there's potential there... but a little bit of quality control goes a long way, and is something this game is lacking.

author: {'steamid': '76561198233452204', 'num_games_owned': 801, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1447141441}
review: This game is absolutely ridiculous.  Tons of fun but the controls are kinda wonky.  If you dont sshoot the cows in just the right spot, you miss them which makes it really hard to get all  three badges for any given level.  Good concept but i can see it getting highly repetitive.  I just got it because it has 5 achievements that seemed pretty easy to get and i love hunting achievements. Have fun with it guys :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198127314221', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1695617318}
review:
As many of us are aware, the "indie developer" scene is exploding as of late when it comes to game creation. With so many independent companies trying to stake their claim in the gaming world, it's tough to keep track of games that are truly worthy of attention, versus those that are... well... just white noise. Among these developers is a company by the name of Decaying Logic, and they have created a unique take on the sidescrolling shooter with "Culling of the Cows."

     "Culling of the Cows" is game that is based around, you guessed, killing hordes of livestock that seem to have been infected or otherwise possessed by some strange force. Rather than feeding on hay or grass like their "more alive" brethren, the cattle of CotC prefer the taste of meat. Thankfully though, "God" and his newly appointed tool of destruction, Sammy, have something else in mind: to eliminate the existence of these flesh-craving, ravenous bovine zombie hordes. The entire game revolves entirely around this idea and it is very well executed in doing so.

     Through each level, the player is given the option to choose between several different types of ammo that range from the typical 12 gauge buckshot, all the way up to exploding rounds. These ammo types can be purchased with the in-game credits that are given to Sammy at the beginning of each level. Not only does Sammy old boy get credits at the start of each stage, but he also has the chance to earn more by supply drops. Supply drops give the player a random chance to get certain temporary upgrades, such as the aforementioned credits as well as ammo reloads or speed boosts just to name a few. On top of these supply drops (if the level permits) Sammy can call upon God to rain down various "miracles" which, in all honesty, is pretty much a full military arsenal to rain down death upon the infected livestock. The fun doesn't stop there though!

     Aside from all of the neat little upgrades and quirky buffs given to the player, there is also quite the selection of enemies. Some easy to kill like the typical black cow, while others... well... they need a little more "convincing" in order to admit defeat at the hands of our hillbilly protagonist. The levels are numerous and the entertainment value can be described as somewhat worthy. At times, the game will seem to get redundant, but it's definitely a must-have if you are in the mood for getting your hands dirty with a little mindless arcade "shoot to kill" action.

     As far as true replay value goes, there might be some to be considered. Given the short nature of the game, speed runs can most definitely be considered. Or... if you wanna try your hand at a perfect run on every level, that is most certainly an option as well!

   Overall, Culling of the Cows makes its unique mark on the Indie Dev world and although it is rather short in gameplay length, the features that are included make it well worth the price. Whether you are looking for a time killer, or wanting a new "speed run" challenge to compete with friends with, or even just looking for a good challenge to achieve that perfect score, CotC definitely delivers.

For more information on Culling of the Cows, or to download the game for yourself, please visit:
http://decayinglogic.com/the-culling-of-the-cows/




Be sure to check out my other content!

author: {'steamid': '76561197973786715', 'num_games_owned': 1942, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1445233577}
review:
I have over 500 games in my Steam account, and the vast majority of them are still unplayed. So now I'm dedicating an hour to each of these games and writing a series of One Hour Reviews. An hour isn't very long to judge a game on, so think of this as more of a first impression, and take this review in the spirit in which it's given. Be sure to read other reviews from players who have spent more time in the game. 

One Hour Reviews #36 - The Culling of the Cows

The game description notes that this is a combination side-scrolling shooter/tower defense game.  But I wouldn't put much emphasis on tower defense.  Really the focus of this game is on the shooting.  The gameplay primarily consists of you shooting at cows which charge at you from the right side of the screen.  You have to be lined up vertically with the cow in order to hit it when you shoot.  This is a fair bit trickier than it sounds, as the side scrolling perspective works against you here.  I had a lot of cases where I was sure I was lined up, only to see my bullet miss.

In addition to shooting at cows, you also have to dodge them as they charge you.  If a cow touches you, then you are immediately gored to death.  There's no health bar or second chance here, so you have to be careful.  This was another case where I found the perspective difficult to deal with, as my bullet would miss the cow, but it had no problem goring me.

There isn't much of a tower defense aspect to the game, other than the fact that you are limited in how many cows you can let pass.   Let too many pass and you'll lose.  So you have to be pretty quick, and missing a shot will cost you valuable time reloading.  Some games you can reload your entire magazine at once when you run out of bullets.  But in this game, you reload a single bullet at a time, and it takes some time, so every missed shot counts.

This is where the strategy comes in, although I use that term lightly.  The game gives you money to spend on upgrades.  So for instance you can buy an upgrade that gives your gun a laser sight, to help you line up your shots (it didn't help me at all).  Or you can buy an upgrade that lets you load an additional bullet at a time (far more useful).  You can also upgrade your ammunition.  Since money is limited, the strategy comes in wisely spending what you have on the right items.

The other bit of strategy comes in the form of a parachute that drops a care package with something random that's useful.  It takes a while to recharge so the trick is deploying it when you start getting overwhelmed.

The graphics are pretty simplistic, but I did like the art style.  I wasn't as impressed with the animation, particularly for the player.

Overall I found the game to be more difficult than I expected, due to the one 'one touch and your dead' mechanic.  In fact I never made it past the 4th stage in the time I played.  But I figure if the game is already that hard for me, I'm probably not missing that much other than even harder enemies to kill and more variety in weapons, etc.

When you add in the $12.99 price tag, I really can't justify that for a game that I had so little fun with.  There are far better shooters, far better tower defense games, and far better games in general for the money.  Culling of the Players would be a more accurate title for this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137968891', 'num_games_owned': 293, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1445125489}
review:
[b] TLDR: ONLY BUY THIS ON SALE [/b]  
Who knew killing cow's could be so deeply satisfying? Or so intensely frustrating? At it's core this game is a shooting gallery, but instead of shooting smiling yellow ducks, you're faced with angry rampaging zomby-cows. It's easy to get the hang of but as the difficulty starts to ramp up, so do the games flaws. Each level adds a new and tougher type of cow, as well as a new "Divine Intervention" ability. 
It is beyond annoying to reach the end of the level only to be gored by a green bull streaking across the screen. This is largely due to the poor movement controls, which are painfully unresponsive and make aiming tough. 
It is undeniably satisfying to litter the farmyard with cow corpses, but it's simply not worth a whole $12 (I got it from a giveaway some time ago, so I really shouldn't complain) 
[b] I would recommend this game only if you can find it under $2 [/b]

review:
Juego puro arcade. Dispara, dispara y espera.... dispara otra vez.

Trata de sobrevivir a hordas de diferentes tipos de vacas zombies. Tu controlas a tu ganadero con tu escopeta y aguanta hasta que acabes con el ultimo zombie.

 Es un juego flash, no se le puede pedir grandes graficos, pero cumplen su cometido.

Tiene una curva de dificultad media, aunque con paciencia se acaba el juego.

Recomendado si te gustan las vacas, los juegos arcades y te gustan nuevas experiencias... Juego recomendado.

Nota: Juego caro al precio que lo venden, no pagaria mas de 2 euros para las casi 5 horas de juego que ofrece.

Un "giochino" in linea con la moda zombie; la storia non esiste, ma in questo tipo di giochi non credo faccia molta differenza.

Ho trovato il livello di difficoltÃ  leggermente in calo, una volta capito come funzionano i potenziamenti e trovato il proprio stile, diventa giusto un premere il mouse per sparare, ricaricare e utilizzare gli aiuti forniti dal gioco. (Sempre che non si voglia ottenere tutte le medaglie per completismo, in quel caso forse la sfida diventa piÃ¹ complessa)

Se volete passare qualche ora senza pensieri fa al caso vostro. L'assenza di trama o di meccaniche complesse lo rende un gioco perfetto per chi ha poco tempo o per staccare da giochi piÃ¹ impegnativi.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038604011', 'num_games_owned': 914, 'num_reviews': 232, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1444095462}
review:
The Culling of the Cows is... well bland.

Iâ€™m not sure exactly what the genre would be called; you are an old farmer with a shot gun taking out mutant/zombie cows before they can reach the barn behind you. Itâ€™s the kind of goofy flash game you would see on Newgrounds back in the day, but not one you would ever be expected to pay for. The movement is a little stiff and the shots donâ€™t actually seem to register correctly about 1/3 of the time, which is exacerbated by the flat south park-esque characters giving you no good indication of depth down range. I played it for around 20 or 30 minutes and was quite bored, then booted it back up when I noticed an announcement on the Library page: Cheat Codes Added. Generally cheat codes end up ruining the fun of a game, but in a game like this maybe skipping to the excitement would keep me engaged for at least a while longer. I activated God Mode, unlocked all the upgrades, and added an MG nest to the top of the barn; awesome right? Except it wasnâ€™t. There wasnâ€™t any big spectacle, the MG was anemic at best, and God Mode only lasted roughly 15 seconds.

I donâ€™t know if Iâ€™m missing something or if there are some shady things going on because the overall consensus is Very Positive at the time of writing this. I got this as a free key from some bundle website a while back and I almost regret having it in my library. It functions enough to be acceptable on a flash game website but Iâ€™ll be hiding it in my Steam library and never touching it again.
