author: {'steamid': '76561198044116231', 'num_games_owned': 517, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1444761083}
review: I got this game for free some time ago, and I have to admit that it is some of the most fun I've had in quite some time. The game is farily straightforward... survive waves of zombies (mainly cows) and complete the game. While playing, you do get all sorts of abilities and upgrades that you can make use of. The only negative critic that I have towards this game is that it's incredibly easy and can be completed in under two hours. In that sense I don't think paying $12.99 is quite worth it, also since at this stage there are only five achievements who are also very easy to accomplish. Other than that, this game is really fun to play, and I would definitely recommend anyone giving it a shot, especially if you can get the game for free :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198104908950', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1437701269}
review:
Zombie cows, Nazi UFOs and a crazy old coot farmer... Never a dull moment in this game.
The game is fairly enjoyable and I personally liked the levels where you had to shoot enemies with a machine gun (made me feel like Rambo). 
I wouldn't recommend buying this game at full price as it is rather short, but grab it if it goes on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159004501', 'num_games_owned': 730, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1443095931}
review:
[h1]Gutes Spiel mit viel Frustpotential[/h1]

Dieses Spiel ist ein 2D Arcade Shooter der sich ums Thema Zombies handelt. Man spielt einen Farmer der Horden von Zombies, sowie an einige Stellen auch Bossgegner, besiegen muss. Dabei setzt man seine Schrotflinte sowie auch UnterstÃ¼tzungen ein die einem das Level erleichtern kÃ¶nnen. Die Schrotflinte lÃ¤sst sich Upgraden wodurch sich spezialmunition verwenden lÃ¤sst, die MunikapazitÃ¤ten grÃ¶ÃŸer werden, schnelleres Nachladen oder einfach schnelleres SchieÃŸen. Dabei muss man taktisch vorgehen denn die Waffe lÃ¤sst sich nur in dem jeweiligen Level mit Geld upgraden was ziemlich wenig vorhanden ist. Das bringt den Spieler manchmal vor schwierige Entscheidungen und machen das Spiel dadurch lebendiger und schwieriger. Die Gegnertypen sind zahlreich und treten in Horden auf sodass einem nie die Gegner ausgehen werden. 
Wer das Spiel durchspielen will (alle Steam-Errungenschaften) sollte ohne Cheats seine Zeit brauchen (20+ Level bis Endboss) Mit Cheats geht es aber bedeutent einfacher sodass man 1-1,5h brauchen wird. FÃ¼r die hohe Anzahl an Level ist der Preis von 11â‚¬ ok, dennoch empfehle ich, es sich wÃ¤hrend einer Rabattaktion zu holen. 

[b]Edit:[/b] wÃ¤hrend eines Levels ist es nicht mÃ¶glich zu speichern sodass man beim mitunter letzten Gegner sterben kann und dann ganze Level wiederholen darf (als kleine Warnung ;) )

author: {'steamid': '76561198061249750', 'num_games_owned': 1173, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1438458512}
review:
There is something infinitely rewarding about slaughtering so many zombie cows that you can't see the ground texture anymore. COTC is simple and harkens to the classic flash game setup, but one thing that most can't deny is that it's downright polished, and lovingly polished at that. 

You have a shotgun. God supports you with farming equiptment and artillery strikes. There is a nazi UFO flying around. There are cows. Zombie cows. There are also some normal zombies sometimes. No one cares about those. You shoot them til they're all dead, as of God's urging. 

This is all you need to know, and honestly, it's not for everyone. The insanely cheap pricetag demands some respect, and there is a surprising amount of content to be had, with a wide variety of levels and challenges, on top of some badge challenges that, while have no incentive, are a fun thing to try and aim for. There are multiple shell types, and each are fun to mess around with, but the buck shot is usually your best bet. You get the point.

The artstyle is absolutely lovely, and the voicework, while obnoxious after a point, is surprisingly competant and hammy.
There is an ending, and an overall plot, which has a kind of sweet if you can get past the final boss (it's a doozy, trust me), but for basic stupid arcade slaughter, you'll absolutely get your money's worth. 

Not for everyone, and arguably not worth the full price.

Definitely looking forward to whatever the developers do that isn't a bunch of jigsaw puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053754931', 'num_games_owned': 2188, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1441937904}
review:
Debo decir que originalmente lo saque gratis de una promo y nomas por las cromos lo instale, pero lo estuve jugando y la verdad es un juego MUY COMPLETO.
A que me refiero ? 
1-Vamos desbloqueando nuestro camino por cada granero, pero podemos elegir graneros que defender dependiendo del camino que tomemos, esto hace que no sea tedioso cuando encontramos uno que no podemos pasar
2-EL sonido y mÃºsica es muy competente, acompaÃ±a de forma perfecta al juego realmente haciendolo muy vistoso sumado a su graficas 2D de animaciÃ³n, puede verse como un Plants vs Zombies pero mÃ¡s frenetico por la musica y animaciÃ³n.
3- Variedad y esto lo aplaudo, hay graneros donde solo defendemos oleadas, otros donde tenemos algÃºn Boss y otros donde tenemos que defender desde arriba del granero, esto le da mucha variedad y que no se sienta monotono el juego, un gran merito de los programadores.  Eso sin decir la gran cantidad de zombies diversos que hay. 

Realmente el juego es muy pero muy bueno, eso si algo corto, no vale la pena por 12 dolares, la verdad si lo agarras en descuento grande vale la pena, la verdad entretiene bastante y espero algÃºn nuevo juego de la gente que hizo este, demostro mucha calidad para un juego del que nadie esperaba nada

author: {'steamid': '76561197977904226', 'num_games_owned': 1151, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1440711911}
review:
[i]Changed to recommended due to lowered retail price[/i]

I'll have to agree with the Steam community that this is some Flash-quality game with its defense-based gameplay concept, reminiscent of some other zombie survival games you could play on a browser. As much as that brief description gives away, it's a low standard game with a few redeeming qualities. However, the game mode variations like wave levels, rampage and onslaught don't do well enough to redeem the monotony of shooting down enemies coming from the right and I find myself yearning to get the game beat so I could move on. Its short length seems justified for its limited variety of content, though.

Speaking of contents, the gun upgrades and assists from "lord above" allowed me to have some fun nailing down hordes of zombies; which feature primarily cows (duh), hippies and, overweight goth girls. The gun upgrades can be bought with credits, where your wealth depends on the level's setting and dropped supplies you get. The variety isn't much but enough for trying out, which fits best for certain situations. The upgrades and assists can make you OP at most in regular levels with these features, along with badges to encourage you to take on more challenges.

The soundtrack is nicely varied, which during level playthrough is appropriately pumping for the mood of shooting battleground but none too intrusive nor repetitive enough to an annoyance. I can hear some elements of bluegrass, rock and electronics being mixed in. As for the sound effects, they are relatively lo-fi but mesh well with the cartoon environment. The one-line dialogues add up to the humor, setting a lighter mood on the zombie apocalypse environment, which I find welcome enough.

It's simplistic in gameplay and lacking in variation so, fun for some people, there is a bit of something to be found of value in this repetitive defense shooter.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969036258', 'num_games_owned': 562, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1440684591}
review: McDonald's uvadi farmare, ktery brani svoji stodolu pred zombie dobytkem a dalsima nakazenema mrtvolama. Jelikoz se jedna o byvaleho marinaka, ktery si zavola vrtulnik, bombarder a dokonce i atomovku na pomoc tak je o zabavu postarano. Prvnich nekolik kol da hraci zabrat vic nez dalsich z tezsi obtiznosti - vetsinou staci zavolat podporu a nemusite ani vystrelit patronu. Pokud si chcete odreagovat, nevadi vam trosku nasili a zbrane namirene proti dobytku urcite si to zkuste zahrat. 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198086773602', 'num_games_owned': 1140, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1440519872}
review:
Got the game for free
Sold the cards for $.17
???
Profit

I really did not like the game, its so basic and unpolished that I would not have been surprised to see it on newgrounds. I only played for maybe half an hour, after that I let it idle so that I could get the cards. Apart from my problems with the game itself, there are also:

NO rebindable controls
NO selectable resolution
NO use of the mouse in game; you could have allowed us to click on upgrades, instead of using the number keys.

This just screams "first time game-maker," and if that is the case, keep going buddy! Keep improving and eventually, if you put enough time and effort into it, you will have something that people will want to play and support! It aint this game, though.

The voice acting was surprisingly good, though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011929262', 'num_games_owned': 989, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1440347600}
review: Game has some quirky humor here and there to help rile things up a bit. I also like the overall art style and atmosphere. Neither of these help to save the gameplay though which I found very redundant and at times overly difficult. The main reason I wouldn't recommend this game though is simply because of the small and incosistent hit point of the shotgun. I often miss shots that I feel I should've gotten from this and this gives away the fact that this an indie game. I don't know if this was on purpose to make the game more difficult or this is something that resulted in amateur programming but for me this was a gamebreaker. It's a shame too as I felt the game would've been really fun if it wasn't for the shooting hit points.

review: I got this title for free during a big giveaway. Still, I did not enjoy it. It's a simplistic, protect your house from the cows game, one which is actually fun at the beggining, but as you progress through The Culling of the Cows' levels - gameplay gets boring and rather repetitive. So, in a final veredict, I do not recommend this title, as this game should simply be free-to-play or cheaper than it is, because spending 11 euros on it is a waste of money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095917598', 'num_games_owned': 498, 'num_reviews': 1813, 'playtime_forever': 4335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1666598360}
review:
Excelente tower defense, um dos melhores que jÃ¡ joguei, logo apÃ³s de Plants vs Zombies.O jogo Ã© muito divertido e acaba se tornando viciante,uma mistura de apocalipse zombie com alienÃ­ginas, ambos querendo invadir a fazenda do Seu ZÃ© que defende fortemente com sua espingarda e algumas armadilhas do celeiro.Ã‰ um jogo indie que foi muito bem preparado, porÃ©m, aparentemente a overlay nÃ£o funciona corretamente, embora vocÃª conseguia abrir o painel da Steam e conversar com seus amigos, a opÃ§Ã£o de captura e envio de tela nÃ£o Ã© habilitada, dessa forma se necessita o envio das prints,terÃ¡ que fazer isso manualmente.Vale a pena conferir se vocÃª Ã© fÃ£ do gÃªnero.
The Culling Of The Cows Ã© um game indie bem simples, basicamente vocÃª tem que impedir que as criaturas entrem no celeiro, vocÃª apenas se movimenta para os lados e atira. Apesar de simples ele tem uma temÃ¡tica atÃ© legal e uma trilha sonora que combina, o cenÃ¡rio varia conforme vocÃª avanÃ§a e novos inimigos vÃ£o surgindo. O jogo sÃ³ possui uma arma, uma espingarda que conta com diferentes tipos de muniÃ§Ã£o e vÃ¡rios niveis de upgrade. Enfim, o jogo Ã© legal, mas no meu ver, nÃ£o compensa comprÃ¡-lo no preÃ§o que ele estÃ¡, sÃ³ tenho ele porque ganhei. 

Obs: Por ser um jogo indie nÃ£o vou avaliÃ¡-lo com o mesmo critÃ©rio que avalio os jogos de grandes empresas.

Minha nota: 7,9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198143175966', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1437336917}
review:
Dieses Spiel soll 10,99 â‚¬ kosten! 

Damit habe ich einen der beiden Negativpunkte genannt. Die andere SchwÃ¤che ist, dass bei den meisten Tower Defence Spielen man sich schon im Vorfeld auf die kommenden Gegnerwellen strategisch und manchmal auch taktisch vorbereiten kann/muss. Hier wartet man ab, lÃ¤dt seine Knarre und hofft nicht zu sehr in die Defensive gedrÃ¤ngt zu werden. Was natÃ¼rlich bei AnfÃ¤ngern, wie mir prompt doch passiert und alles in Hektik ausartet.

Ansonsten unterscheidet sich dieses TD-Spiel von den anderen durch einen ausgesprochenen Mangel an eigener OriginalitÃ¤t.  Da hilft das gÃ¶ttliche Eingreifen auch nicht mehr (Monty Python lÃ¤sst grÃ¼ÃŸen). Denn alles ist wie gehabt: BrutalitÃ¤t prÃ¤sentiert mit schwarzem Humor (verrÃ¼ckter, alter, schieÃŸwÃ¼tiger Redneck - fast schon ein Klassiker. Neu ist etwas anderes), stÃ¤rker werdende Gegner und Waffenupgrades usw, aber nichts dabei, was diesen Preis gerechtfertigt. Ich habe es kostenlos bekommen, gekauft hÃ¤tte ich es nicht.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996919908', 'num_games_owned': 1532, 'num_reviews': 875, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1436665896}
review:
[h1]Der SchlÃ¤chter aller Rinder[/h1]

Also, bei Culling of the Cows fÃ¤llt einem auf, dass Massentierhaltung vielleicht nicht die beste MÃ¶glichkeit ist. Insbesondere wenn wir es mit vergifteten,untoten und wÃ¼tenden MutantenkÃ¼hen zu tun haben.

Das [b]Gameplay[/b] ist relativ Simpel: In 2D mÃ¼ssen wir eine Scheune gegen Horden von KÃ¼hen und viel schlimmer, Hippies, verteidigen. Dabei spielen wir einen alten Mann, der scheinbar seine Frau retten muss(was ich Ã¼brigens erst in der letzten Schlacht kapiert habe) und metzeln wie wahnsinnig mit einer doppelÃ¤ufigen Schrotflinte alles weg, was nur irgendwie geht. Dabei upgraded man seine Waffe und setzt auch krasse Dinge wie ne Flammenwand, eine sentry gun oder nen gÃ¶ttlichen Meteorschauer(!) ein. Gelegentlich spielen wir dann auch noch einfach nur mit der Maus und mÃ¼ssen mit nem Sturmgewehr oder anderen Spielzeugen die Scheune verteidigen.
Der Anfang ist etwas schwierig, bis man den Dreh raushat und spÃ¤ter bekommt man dann auch mehr Assistances zur UnterstÃ¼tzung. Der Trick ist es, bei wenig Assistance, diese dann einzusetzen, wenn man nachladen muss, was recht lange ohne das zustÃ¤ndige Upgrade dauert. SpÃ¤ter reicht es dann fast aus, nur die Assistance nacheinander zu spammen.

[b]Fazit: [/b]

The Culling of the Cows ist ein recht kurzes Spiel (etwa 4-5 Stunden fÃ¼r alle Level) und man fragt sich ein wenig, was fÃ¼r Drogen die Entwickler genommen haben. Ich persÃ¶nlich hatte ein paar "WTF" und "Oh yeah, lets **** them to death" Momente, die dann ordentlich Laune gemacht haben. Jedoch nervt es manchmal, dass man die Gegner nicht erwischt, obwohl man eigentlich denkt, man wÃ¤re auf der selben HÃ¶he wie sie.
Aber unterm Strich kann ich das Spiel nur empfehlen, allerdings wÃ¼rde ich auf einen Sale warten, da das Spiel meiner Meinung nicht mehr als 5 â‚¬ wert ist. 


Hat dir das Review weitergeholfen? Dann folge mir doch in [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Drakeschool] meiner Steamgruppe[/url], wo ich meine Reviews als Kurator verfasse.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090639171', 'num_games_owned': 534, 'num_reviews': 239, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1436216064}
review:
You play as a farmer who fights for his stable against zombie cows.zombie hippis,zombie "city folk"  and a nazzi space ship.
You literally enjoy throwing a nuke on waves of cows or call for a apache or f-117 to bomb thier beef ass.
Ofc if you like it roasted you have flames to roast them to your taste.

Protect your base from an onslaught of enemies. In this case, crazy cows.

author: {'steamid': '76561198181892639', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1451867670}
review:
[h1] The Culling of the Cows Review[/h1]
So one day, I visited a site that I love to go on for game info, RPS. I saw an advert for a free copy of "Culling of the Cows," so I figured I would give it a try. And I am [b]very[/b] glad that I did.

[h1] Part 1:  Storyline and Gameplay [/h1]
In COTC, you are a farmer who encounters everything from zombie cows to Nazi UFOs on his farm. It is your job to shoot the oncoming cattle and other enemies before they can enter your barn. There is a plethora of upgrades for your weapons, barn, and even "God Abilities." It could be considered a sidescroller (but with no scrolling), but this game will appeal to both arcade gamers and retro shoot-em-up gamers alike.

As for the length of the game, COTC has an adequate number of "missions" which provide for plenty of hours of fun gameplay. And if you ever, for some odd reason, get bored of destroying zombie cows with a barn-mounted machine gun, there are cheat codes to get you to the final mission and other such objectives.

[h1] Part 2: Graphics?  [/h1]
There isn't too much to say about the graphics here. The game could have done well as a pixel graphic game, but I believe that the developers made the right decision sticking with non-pixelated cows. You get an arcade feel from the graphics while still being able to make out sharp lines and appropriate detail.

[h1] Part 3: Is it fun?  [/h1]
Of course it's fun! This game is unlike any other arcade-zombie-tower defense game you've played before! Imagine Farming Simulator, but instead of growing crops, you shoot cows, and instead of upgrading your equipment, you upgrade your explosive-bullet extended mag infinite ammo no reload shotgun! This is a game that you can definitely lose track of time while playing and get caught up in the hilarity and epicness of the goals.

[h1] Value [/h1]
As I said before, I got this game as part of a special promotion, however, I would gladly have bought this game. It's well worth the money (At time of writing: $1.94, 85% off)! Let's put it this way - you can get a pack of gum or two which might last just a few days, or you can get COTC and have dozens of fun hours of gameplay! The only thing is that I feel like $12.99 is a little bit much to ask for regular price, I would wait for it to go on sale. Definitely a game that you can casually pick up right where you left off, even if it's been a week or two. Would recommend.

[table]
    [tr]
        [th]Aspect[/th]
        [th]Rating[/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Gameplay[/td]

        [td]Value[/td]
        [td]7[/td]
    [/tr]

[/table]

[h1] Final Points on the Game [/h1]
This game is a definite buy, whether it's 2 bucks or 10. You'll have a great time playing it, and best of all, it has zombies with [b] no early access [/b]! What's not to love about that!

Be sure to check out any of my other reviews on my profile, and please upvote if this helped you, I hope it did! Thanks for reading!

author: {'steamid': '76561198014417122', 'num_games_owned': 832, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1452430850}
review:
Old arcade type game, overall is a fun game to play while passing some time around. But after awhile it gets a bit repetitive.
The gameplay is pretty straightforward... shoot, shoot and shoot. You have some options for the weapons and skills that you must choose from to help defending your farm, but it's pretty much shooting all way around.
As for the price, not really worth it. There are free flash games that can equal, if not overpass, this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047625879', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1434410379}
review:
Culling of the Cows is a classic base defense shooter upgrade game. However, it really falls short of what one would expect of this type of game. 

-The game has an alright theme which gets a little cliche with the Nazi part and the hands of God.

-The music has little variety in music which gets old quickly.

- The game is far too easy. The enemies don't vary too much and some of the enemies seem pointless or almost to help the player. There is not too much balance and one ammo type is incredibly OP compared to other ones and some of the upgrades are really almost useless. The actives are very very overpowered with a short cooldown. 

-There are three level types aside from the two boss fights and some seem to just drag on.

-There are three medals to each of the levels, but as there are no achievements or rewards that help your gameplay outside of these there's little to no incentive to getting these.

TL:DR - This game is a poor base defense shooter with little variety. There are many of these flash online that are much better. With the exception of maybe the steam cards and an easy perfect game (With a bit of time dragging through it) I would not reccomend paying a cent on this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064592385', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1434312958}
review:
Homemade spghetti sauce
Serves: 8-10
Prep time:  15 mins Cook time:  3 hours Total time:  3 hours 15 mins
Ingredients:
3-4 cans of Crushed Tomatoes (either regular or with basil, oregano and garlic) 28 oz. sized cans OR 12-15 fresh tomatoes (peeled, chopped and blended in a food processor)
4 cloves of garlic
A bunch of dried basil (probably 3-5 Tbsp)
A bunch of black pepper ( probably 1 - 2 tsp)
1 TBSP of Sugar (optional)
2 TSBP olive oil
â…“ cup of grated Parmesan or Romano Cheese
Minced Green Peppers (optional)
Instrucktions:
1.Heat the olive oil in a 5+ qt. pot over medium heat, and add the chopped or pressed garlic.
Heat for one to two minutes, making sure not to burn the garlic, then add all the tomatoes, black pepper, basil and sugar. Stirring often, bring to a low boil.
Reduce heat to low and simmer for 2-3 hours stirring often.
For the first half of the simmer time, do so with the pot uncovered, then cover.
Add the cheese, stir in and simmer for an additional 5 minutes or so.
This will make the equivalent to 4-5 jars of sauce, and the cost is probably about half (and it tastes way better).
- See more at: http://www.iamthatlady.com/frugal-pasta-sauce-recipe-using-hunts-crushed-tomatoes/#sthash.GRoGbHuL.dpuf

author: {'steamid': '76561198013287771', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1434282861}
review:
Concept is nice, but it's just unplayable.

CONS : Controls are the worst ever, even controller controls suck monkey balls.
If you get hit once, you are dead. You got to restart at the beginning of the level, not even at the start of your wave.
The whole game is based on shooting cows in different lanes, but the 3D is so bad you often don't even see in what lane the cow is. 
And the cows at the bottom run up a little, even more confusing.

PRO'S: Concept is fun, but yeah...

2/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198182128331', 'num_games_owned': 100, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1433853749}
review:
The Culling of the Cows is an absurdist gag game that, while it may provide you with all the rampant bovine slaughter you could ever dream of, is as of now not at all worth the price paid for it.

As a lone farmer stranded in rural 'Murica, you must overcome the armies of mutant cows, deranged hippies and obese gothic women that a Nazi UFO sends your way. By reading the previous sentence, it should be quite clear that this game is not taking itself too seriously. However, there is a clear difference between random humor with a purpose and random just for random's sake; this game strictly falls into the latter. Culling is basing its appeal entirely on the fact that the player gets to shoot cows...a lot. All of the other plot points mentioned in the beginning of this paragraph receive no explanation besides a single introduction screen per plot point, and are otherwise meant to serve as comedic masks for generic enemy types.

The game's fundamentals are disappointingly lacking. Gameplay is divided into levels that contain encounters in either standard "Waves" format, a variation of Waves that is only one large wave, or a last-stand turret mode called "Onslaught". The majority of the game's levels occur in the Waves format, with varying numbers and types of enemies and waves for each level. This variety does little to put off the repetition that sets in after a few rounds of slaughtering the same few animals and zombies over and over. The Waves format does allow for some character customization in weapon upgrades, but after a certain amount of experimentation I discovered an order of upgrades that, with moderate skill, could win all the levels. Some incentive in the level design to switch up gameplay styles would have gone a long way. The other gameplay mode, Onslaught, produces some of the most frustrating levels in the game due to sketchy hit detection, though it often provides a refreshing and enjoyable break from the Waves levels as well.

Various other parts of the game fail to stand out. The soundtrack isn't memorable and the art style has this feel to it that so many indie games seem to have, which at worst could be descibed as "one step above MS Paint". Largely, the game isn't bad-looking; it just has a habit of piling hundreds of multicolored cow corpses on the screen at once, which grates on the senses and leaves a lasting impact after seeing it over and over. Some parts of the game seem to be implemented strangely: controller support, despite being labelled as both "partial" and "full", relegates movement solely to the D-Pad, which is an odd choice. Culling's achievements are also strange: there are only five, four can be attained by the third level (two are bugged to only work with the keyboard) and the fifth is for beating the game. More achievements could help boost replayability, a facet which is important in this game considering it can be finished in just over three hours. Though most levels contain medals to earn for winning under certain conditions, the game doesn't offer rewards for earning the medals, which makes them largely meaningless. Perhaps tying some customization unlocks to medals would solve this issue?

Though this game faces significant issues, I must give praise to the spirit of the developers. They've implemented some features like an internal cheat console, the achievements and trading cards by popular demand. Additionally, their desire to not make this game be simply a joke shows throughout the game. The farmer's voiceover has some genuinely unique and funny lines interspersed throughout the game, which work because the lines are not beaten to death in every level. As long as the developers stand by the good-hearted cow hate that is the root of this game, there's hope that this could turn into an indie cult classic in the future.

This game has set off on a mission: to spread the need to shoot cows whenever, wherever. It tries to achieve its goals through a game that has significant flaws. Should the developers focus on the problems that plague the core elements of the game, then this title will definitely deserve a second look. As of now, however, there is no way anyone would feel satisfied paying full price for this game. Save up for a sale, perhaps gift this to a friend in jest. Just...beware the cows. The Culling of the Cows gets a D.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139920987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1433144110}
review:
If you're vegan or vegetarian, I do not recommend this game for you. If you're an animal rights activist and are against harming cows, do not play this. If you are any of the above and you decide to play it, don't have a cow about it in the reviews section.

Okay for real though...

I found this game rather amusing. I haven't played much of it but I did get a few little laughs out of it. It's not much of a challenging game but it is a game that let's you kill small amounts of time (and savage cows).

I see that it is currently on sale for $1.29 USD - I think that's a fair price. The asking price of $12.99 is a bit far for a game as simple as this one. I got this in a deal so I was pretty lucky. 

There simply can be no discussion about how 'good' the greaphics are etc, As this just feels like a mobile game. It's been done before (not sure with savage cows...) so it lacks a little creativity but I do like the farmer v cows aspect.

I can see this being a great game for the younger audience though, and that is why I am recommending it. 

It's fairly easy to grasp and it can entertain for a little bit. I assume kids will love it and play it for hours on end. 

Kudos to the developer, I appreciate your hard work. Hope you had fun making it :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197989905894', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 381, 'last_played': 1442629656}
review:
[b]The Culling Of The Cows[/b] is a 2D Shooter.

â€œHilarious in its purest essenceâ€ 
NerdMaldito 

Yes, it's hilarious. You start the game as an old farmer trying to protect your barn with a shotgun. Then you fight some waves of cows.. [b]Zombie Cows![/b] They will try to pass through you and you must shot them down so they can't enter the barn. In each level, the difficulty increases until the very end when the [b]Nazi UFO[/b] comes to beat you.

[b]Pros:[/b]
- Funny game 
- Easy to understand 
- Challenging (to get all the achievements)

[b]Cons:[/b]
- The price makes no sense
- The game is short
- A co-op would be fun


[b]MY RATING:[/b] 5/10



[i]If you liked this review please consider giving it a thumbs up and if you disliked post in the comments on what you disliked about the review.[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198062813911', 'num_games_owned': 1958, 'num_reviews': 2050, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1433423725}
review:
[h1] DISCLAIMER: This is a full review, and NOT a first impressions review like all my other reviews, if you want a better full review, then please read better reviews then mine [/h1]

[quote] PLEASE NOTE: I recommended this game with some exceptions, overall if the game did not live up to just a tiny expectation, I would not have recommended it at all, so please read the review carefully if you are thinking of buying/playing this game [/quote]

Imagine the famous and disgusting Mad Cow's disease placed together with the cruelty of the videos by PETA and you've got the bloodbath which is The Culling Of The Cows

The game is alright, nor is it horrible, nor is it unplayable. The game follows a farmer who tries to protect his barn/farm from the diseased alien cows and human zombies. The game is like a tower defense game, where you play the farmer shooting your way through hordes of cows, with a little variety here and there. The concept is okay but can get a little repetitious at certain parts.

Although its a fun little game to play, there are a few problems. Firstly, the reloading of the gun. Although I understand that the developers wanted you to take care of not only shooting the enemies right in front of you but also taking care of your gun, however, this can get annoying and when you are in desperate need for ammo, you have to reload, and the reload speed is so slow, you might as well either let the cow into the barn or get yourself ripped apart by the cows themselves.

Another thing which really bugged me was that there was no checkpoint system whatsoever, this can get really frustrating as you immediately die, and if, let's say you were in Wave 7, you would have to begin all the way back to Wave 1! Very annoying!!

Another thing is the farmer himself, he walks too slow and his reload speed is slow too. I can understand they made him the stereotypical old hillbilly farmer, but whenever you are in a tight situation, your kinda stuck.

For the level of difficulty, its not as bad a RADical ROACH Deluxe Edition (which is made by the same people who made this!), however, without the checkpoint system and the slow walk and reload speed, you may need to repeat a stage more than 3 times! A thing which I learnt and really gets you fast running through the wave is to use the powers given to you (ex: A turret, or a meteor shower) wait until its done then shoot until it reloads, simplest way... and it worked for me!

The music can get a bit repetitious and annoying and the sound quality varies from time to time. Reminds me of the sound quality from One Finger Death Punch where the mentor would speak into the microphone that's recording his voice so close.

The story... I have no idea what the story is all about. The game literally throws you into the game without even telling you why the cows are mad as they are and why you are trying to protect your house and barn, [spoiler] SPOILER ALERT! - or why there is a huge Nazi UFO attacking your house! [/spoiler] The game literally does not tell you what's going on, to get a glimpse about the story, I had to go and watch the trailer on their store page!

Now to the recommendation, I have to say that the game was fun to play, however, for the price its asking for... no way would I recommend it, I got this game for free from a giveaway by the way. Its not worth the amount the game company is asking for! For its full price, I would not recommend it, BUT if it is either in a sale, price drop, giveaway, gift or even given to you as a free game like I got it then I would recommend it.

[h1] RECOMMENDED :) [/h1]
[i] Provided it is in a sale, price drop, giveaway, gift or even given to you as a free game, otherwise... [/i]

[h1] NOT RECOMMENDED :( [/h1]
[i] For its full price [/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198027008659', 'num_games_owned': 910, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1436125319}
review:
The Bad
To starts out about 60% of the time this game starts with a white screen forcing me to restart the game
$12.99 is way to much for this game. 
There is a lack of explanation on what upgrades do or how to get them. 
Can become repetitious very fast.

The Good 
It can be fun, there is something about killing zombie cows because God told you to.
The levels are short and in wave format so easy it is to play for 10 minutes and then put it down.

Honestly this game feels like it would be at home on Newgrounds. 
As I type this Culling of the Cows is $1.29 USD which is about the right price to pick it up at as the normal price of 12.99 is way to much for what you get. If you must pick it up do it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074130808', 'num_games_owned': 1067, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1434837993}
review:
You are a redneck farmer and you have got a small problems. Thousands of cows from the vicinity have not gone just mad, they have became zombies. You have to defend your barn with your good ol' rifle and hope zombie hippies and MLB stars won't prove to be too much for you. 

+ Humorous 
+ Nice graphics
+ No problems with controls
+ Has cards & achievements (the devs said they are working on more of them - for now you get 4 of them almost immediately and the last one when you finish the game - easy for now, good for achievement hunters)

- The game tells you can upgrade ammo, weapon and use some assists but does not really explain the types it offers. You have to either try them out yourself or google it.
- You can upgrade stuff but the side-objectives typically suggest you use neither. Come on.... at least leave the player with one of them
- Price (I have got the game for free but I cannot see paying for this 11â‚¬... Now it is on sale for about 1â‚¬, that is the maximum its worth I would say).
- I played a mission or two and closed the game to play later again. Did this several times and I always had to go to audio settings to lower it (its too damn loud). Always.
- Not really much replayability. 

5/10 do not buy unless heavily discounted

author: {'steamid': '76561198079480232', 'num_games_owned': 750, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1433190633}
review: Definitely not worth the original price, or even on sale. I got it for free and it's potential is wasted by bad hitboxes (you sometimes miss a cow and don't understand how), a flawed money/upgrade system and very scripted boss fights. I have played flash games that are of better quality than this. Gets boring extremely quickly, but you can finish the achievements around the same time you get all the card drops, this is one of the only positive sides of this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098229578', 'num_games_owned': 1849, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1433026583}
review:
Moo!?!?

Not a bad little game to play for a bit, but is repetitive and gets pretty tired pretty quick, so best to play in short bursts. There's a cheat which unlocks all levels and doesn't effect the achievements, so it's possible to get 100% on this game VERY easily... if you don't mind a little cheating that is. 

If you would like some 2D zombie bovine action then I would recommend that you wait until this title is on offer (no matter how specifically this game meets your needs), as Â£8.99 is a bit steep for what you get.

author: {'steamid': '76561198149511370', 'num_games_owned': 501, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1433040511}
review: The Culling Of The Cows es muy entretenido, El juego es algo corto, pero muy divertido, si te gustan los juegos de defensa, este sera de tu gusto entonces, Los graficos no estan mal, La musica es buena, Aliens + Zombies + Vacas + Toros Â¿Que mas se puede pedir?, Ademas cuentas con diferentes tipos de municion para tu escopeta "Normal, Expanciva, Penetracion y Explosivo", y tambien cuentas con lanza granadas y una Ametralladora... La historia es aceptable y sin embargo puedo decir que este juego vale la pena jugarlo alguna vez, para terminar yo le doy un 8/10 :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198014926595', 'num_games_owned': 775, 'num_reviews': 967, 'playtime_forever': 337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1569049703}
review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=96ogo6N3stQ

(In case the video gets taken down:  Old people are the GREATEST!  They're full of wisdom and experience!)

Also, old people are filled with Christianity, schizophrenia, and bad-assitude...with a shotgun!   This quest will last you about 2-3 hours.  About 5 hours if you choose to accomplish every challenge there is.  This creepy defense-based game is guarenteed to grant you quite a bit of fun.  :)

Gameplay-wise, it's very similar to Get Off My Lawn...only with differences like "Enemies hitting you results in instant death", "Assists from God", "Gun upgrades" (Both games have ammo upgrades), and it's a side-scroller.   Personally, I found this game to be easier than Get Off My Lawn.

Pros:
Badass chiptune music as you blast away at the undead horde
Silly one-liners
A fair variety of undead enemies to slaughter
Casual with senseless violence.  Great for your down-time.

Cons:
Yet another zombie game (if this doesn't bother you, disregard)
Replayability is a tad limited.


If references to God bother you or if you're a vegetarian, you might wanna avoid this title.

If you're interested in this title, I recommend waiting for a price-drop or a giveaway.  $13 is honestly too high of a price for this particular title.


THANK YOU, PCGAMER!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197988593254', 'num_games_owned': 528, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1432899420}
review:
If you can get this game for free or with a huge discount - then you can go and grab it. Otherwise it's way too expensive for what's inside of it technically and content-wise. Had fun for some hours just because of the game setting and that that the game is (feels?) as a TD'ish game and I absolutely love TD games.

- The hitboxes seem to be a bit off (so does the airdrops) - you have to get used to them and that doesn't really happen in one wave/round.
- Levels are more or less repetitive: once you discover that "6" + "z" + "x" maxed out = ezbash, you don't have much of a thrill to play, since you don't have to aim with it accurately anymore.
- Variety of ... cows (among them also fat goth chicks) and hippies/basballers is poor - you get to meet most of them in first levels already.
- Not much of an explanations on what does each upgrade exactly do (or did I missed that part out?).
- It's definitely not worth 10,99â‚¬ price
- No replay value whatsoever
- Sounds and music gets annoying at times

+ Although it has it's (plenty of) minuses, it's still fun (for no reason) to mow down everyone's hated cow-zombies
+ Simplicity of the game mechanics makes it easy to finish (not really rapidly growing difficulty until last boss) in less than 4 hours
+ Somewhat nice visuals (although, as already mentioned in other reviews - looks more as a flash game)
+ Last boss

TL;DR
75% off, fix hitboxes and I'd recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987388969', 'num_games_owned': 1737, 'num_reviews': 235, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1439186908}
review: A simplistic little survival game, where you are armed with a Shotgun and must survive waves of zombie cows. Gun Mods and power ups are available, as you progress level through level; However, the cows also progress from a standard zombie cow to a charging green bull. This gives the game a level of difficulty, necessary to make it a fun challenge and keep you wanting to play more. The graphics are low quality, but that is all part of the simplistic fun of the game. I had a lot of fun with it and would give it a thumbs up, if for nothing else then it is good for a laugh when you get gored by a zombie cow.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051680934', 'num_games_owned': 203, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1433232642}
review:
[b] [h1] Good game [/h1] [/b]
Not exactly the best game ever made, but the artstyle is cool, the game is challenging in the later stages and there is some strategy involved.

This is the kind of game that you play if you have nothing else to play, but it's a unique and fun shoot-em-up game.
The enemies in the game all have different ways of trying to get in, so acctually have to think about what to when trying to take them out

author: {'steamid': '76561198081984624', 'num_games_owned': 425, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1679730891}
review:
Although I do love this game and enjoy it, I am not recommending it due to some issues that make it not worth the price of $13. Here are the issues:

Repetitiveness:
Obviously in any tower-defense type of game you are going to see some repetitiveness involving the levels that you play. However, I feel that this game does an okay job when it comes to level variety. There are 3 types of levels that you can play,  but they are all basically the same type of level just with a minor change that doesn't make it stand out to the others.

Lag:
Although I do not usually write about lagging issues in a review due to me playing on a laptop and it usually being on my side of the experience, there is a major issue that needs to fixed ASAP. This has to do with the dead bodies left on the screen. If you notice in any other tower-defense game such as Plants Vs. Zombies for example, the bodies always disappear after a short while of sitting on the ground. This game does not do that, and I found that as I progress on through the waves of enemies, their bodies stay laying on the ground and actually cause the game to slow down and lag making it nearly impossible to successfully complete the level. 

So is the game fun? Yes. I enjoy this game very much cause it does a great job at being a game that is challenging while still being fun. Is it worth $13? As it stands, no. The only reason I got this game was through a key giveaway for the game and I of course enjoy free games. I was shocked however to see that the price of this game to be $13 when stopping by to write a review. The game needs a lot of work before it would be worth that price, but if you don't mind it go ahead and buy it however I will not recommend this game for these reasons.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962402602', 'num_games_owned': 2596, 'num_reviews': 361, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1432933424}
review:
[url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FlTkGmj_e3g]The Last Stand[/url] is a free Flash game, and it's much better than this, because it avoided [i]Cows'[/i] glaring design flaws.

The biggest problem is that you can't aim your shotgun freely - it's always pointed straight across the screen, like in an old arcade game. Even though you are clearly firing a spread of pellets from your shotgun, you have to be very careful that you're not too high or too low to hit the stampeding cow (all of which KILL YOU IN ONE HIT). Again, I'm used to this kind of system from old arcade games, but it feels [b]unfair[/b] in this game, especially given the way that cows will run in fast at a diagonal. There's actually a laser sight upgrade for your shotgun, but it doesn't help much.

Your shotgun has a high ammo capacity (especially if you upgrade it) but you have to reload [i]each[/i] shell manually by pressing R. (This is more annoying than it sounds).

You have sentry guns and such that you can activate to kill some cows for you, but you have to activate most of them at just the right time, which is not really practical with the standard mouse+keyboard controls.

...What's that you say? You'll just use a controller with a nice, convenient button for each trap? Nope, sorry, but controller support is [b]AWFUL[/b]. You can only move around with the directional pad (the sticks do nothing!), and there are no dedicated buttons for the traps and upgrades. (The game actually tells you "Controllers are for pussies!" when you select it in the options menu. That's the quite the excuse for terrible support...)

Also, the levels end up covered in so many cow corpses that it becomes difficult to tell which still need shooting (some of the basic enemies stop moving for a second or two, which ends up faking you out) and of course having to climb over dozens of their fallen cow-sisters doesn't slow them down at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049596411', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1684630262}
review:
First let me say that although I recommend this game, it is solely because of the good gameplay. I was able to get this game for free and I enjoy it. Would I pay 13 bucks for a game like this? Absolutely not. 

This game is some old school flash game fun. You're a farmer killing zombie cows and hippies with shotguns while yelling random things about Alex Jones and such. You have ammo and weapon upgrades along with support each level in the form of sentry guns and stealth bombers. It's pretty much your average tower defense shooter. 

All in all it provided me with a good afternoon's worth of entertainment. I enjoyed it, but the price is way too steep. I would only pay 5 dollars tops for a game of this caliber. If you are going to purchase it, then you should wait until a steam sale lowers the price or something, because 13 dollars is a crime for the amount of content you're getting with this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027199558', 'num_games_owned': 1075, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1516945080}
review:
Crappy hit detection kills this game, there is simply no depth of field telling me where I can hit enemies, a simple shadow effect on the ground could have done the game wonders.

On the other hand, the whole 'Standard Issue' challenge that I've yet to see give any reward other then the challenge continues to frustrate me to no end, and otherwise makes all the creative upgrades of the game fly out the window when I'm forced to use the basic shotty on every level or feel like I'm not playing the game to my best.

I wish I could like this game, but it's rather shitty when I have to get shitty over not hitting a shitty cow with my shitty gun thanks to shitty depth perception.

... Shit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094088790', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1432777979}
review:
I got this through a giveaway, absolutely not worth the asking price of $13/â‚¬11, or even half of that, due to being very short and easy. This could easily have been a free flash game on Newgrounds and probably would have been a few years ago.

That said, the game is a lot of fun for what it lasts (about 2 hours). Anyone who loved Plants VS Zombies will feel right at home with the general atmosphere and charm that pervade it.

The game could have definitely used a little more playtesting; not because it's broken or anything, but because of how easily exploitable it is: the spread gun (activated by pressing 6 on the keyboard) is incredibly overpowered, and will easily dispatch hordes upon hordes of enemies without any difficulty, completely eliminating the need for accuracy. Couple that with readily accessible upgrades for larger magazine, faster reloading and fire rate, and you will soon put up a barrage of fire that won't let anything through.

Also overpowered are the special "killstreaks", like sentry guns and helicopters, which are fine per se, but have cooldowns that are way too short, making them easy to spam, especially when you get four slots of them.

Extra challenge is available under the form of medals for each level, daring you to play without upgrading your gun or using any special ability, although as far as I could see, the game doesn't seem to offer any reward for completing them.

Definitely get this while it's free or when on sale for under 2 bucks for an evening of quality uncomplicated entertainment, just do not fork out the absurd $13 asking price which, in the end, is the only major flaw of this cool little game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042292886', 'num_games_owned': 281, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1432009757}
review:
[h1]General Thoughts[/h1]
i got this game through a random steam key purchase. It's not exactly worth the value that I put into it, but putting money aside, this game is essentially a 2.5D Tower Defense game featuring Zambie Cows. You're the last living redneck living off the face of some rural area and your belief in God has given you the ability to receive care packages to take more undead cows down. Pretty unique if you ask me.

As far as gameplay mechanics go, I wish it was playtested a bit more. [b]I probably did not play this long enough,[/b] but aiming the cows is just as hard as reloading; you only reload one buckshot each time you press the reload button, and there are times where the bullets go past the cow. There was an upgrade that allows you to have a laser sight on your shotgun, but it's not exactly as helpful as you would expect. [b](The cows are transparent to these laser sights)[/b]

That being said however, it's not a bad game. This game could pass off as a flash game you play online and this would be the "full version" to put it in a different perspective. Since I got this off a random steam key purchase, I'd have to say it was worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119601567', 'num_games_owned': 778, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1429916377}
review:
Bienvenid@s a mi anÃ¡lisis del juego The Culling of The Cows

El juego mÃ¡s parecido que he jugado a este es Plantas vs. Zombies, aunque sin duda alguna, Plantas vs. Zombies es mucho mejor.

[h1]Historia[/h1]

La historia, en caso de poder considerarla historia, nos cuenta la historia de un granjero que es atacado por zombies y se tiene que defender.

[h1]Jugabilidad[/h1]

Nos podemos mover en todas las direcciones y desde la derecha van apareciendo zombies a los que debemos matar.
Tenemos una tecla para recargar y una para disparar. Poco mÃ¡s.
Cada nivel tiene varoas oleadas de enemigos que debemos aniquilar.

[h1]GrÃ¡ficos[/h1]

El juego utiliza principalmente colores como el amarillo. Las opciones de personalizaciÃ³n de los grÃ¡ficos son casi nulos.
La interfaz de inicio es poco original.

[h1]Audio[/h1]

El audio en la pantalla de inicio es un simplÃ³n. Mientras vamos pasÃ¡ndonos niveles siempre escuchamos el mismo sonido irritante de las vacas.

[h1]ConclusiÃ³n[/h1]

[b]No[/b] recomiendo el juego.

Mi nota para este juego es un [b]suspendido[/b]

El juego en sÃ­ no me ha gustado por una razÃ³n personal (no lo incluyo en mi nota final) y es que se me hace raro matar vacas porque son zombies. SÃ© que es un videojuego pero aÃºn asÃ­ no lo veo muy bien lo de matar vacas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120170624', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1434072181}
review:
Buen juego y muy entretenido, cada nivel es un desafÃ­o cada vez mÃ¡s dificil.

BÃ¡sicamente se trata de defender el granero de un grupo de toros zombies, o de personas zombies utilizando una escopeta con distintos tipos de municiones. Cada nivel tiene oleadas de enemigos y se pueden elegir defensas momentaneas cada cierto tiempo. Los enemigos son de distintos tipos y cada uno tiene un comportamiento especial. Eso hace que el juego sea un reto en cada escenario. 

Lo malo del juego: un poco repetitivo y sin dudas el precio. Es un juego para 2 o 3 dolares no mÃ¡s.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132363843', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1585841201}
review: A game that is difficult, but still has me wanting to play more. A more free tower defense game, where you need skill as well as strategery. I also enjoy how the cows kill you each in their own way...

author: {'steamid': '76561198012778917', 'num_games_owned': 2877, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1429226287}
review:
It definitely has some fun into it, the achievements are easy to get, the game has a lot of cheat codes that makes it funnier and it is not a serious game. The aim is a bit bad, tho, and the laser upgrade doesn't help.
But, overall, the game is pretty fun and you can have some good time with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994499425', 'num_games_owned': 1043, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1429256430}
review: The Culling of the Cows is kind of like a tower defense game, but not really. It's more like hoard mode or arena mode in various games. Basically, you are a farmer, and you shoot zombie cows. You have to manually reload, so you have to take that into consideration as you shoot. It's interesting, but it's just wave after wave of enemies with no real point but to kill more. The visual style is pixelate and 2D, so it's often hard to judge where the bullets will go. Also, it gets kind of boring and repetative after awhile. It's kind of fun though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057903064', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1428759415}
review:
If you like Rambo style and Zombie killing, this will be the one you are looking for. Yeah...That's it...Kill Kill Kill and Kill...
It's not really a good game but you will have some fun ingame. Trust me, you will find some ridiculous things.. (Spoiler : Hand Of God is pointing...)

Achievements are too easy to get... Good for time killing...Guns upgrade and assist systems are coolest things in this game...

If you are hard-core gamers, this is the one of worst games ever you have found on earth.

The bad thing here is IT WORTHs $12.99... Seriously?!

I was really shocked when I found this game on steam store. Oh my goat...

author: {'steamid': '76561198189605322', 'num_games_owned': 1306, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1527250270}
review:
The game is a shooter or tower defense game.  It's a has a crazy plot that includes UFOs, Zombies, rednecks and offcourse Cows.  It has several modes to exploit.  The audio is irritating and game is too short.  It will really test your patience.  I bought it cheap so you get waht you pay for.  All in all, is not a very bad game.  Buy it while it is cheap.  

Note:  The farmer reminds me of Hershel Greene of "The Walking Dead" TV Series

Note:  I mominated this game for The "No Apologies" Award during the Steam Autumn Sale 2017

author: {'steamid': '76561198022820771', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 155, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1427073000}
review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=l8E4_mGM-9c

The Culling of The Cows is a lane defense zombie shoot-em-up festival.  You play as a farmer defending his barn from ever increasing waves of zombies and zombie cows. There is a large variety of what enemies you face as well as various weapons and defense assists that keep the gameplay feeling fresh.

One positive addition to the game is the special achievements, which adds to the ways you can enjoy the game.  The interface is simplistic, as is the gameplay. That being said, it is high paced with a feeling of momentum, and a great threat level. If you find it too easy, there are achievements that add a new layer. It can be repetitive, and I would have liked to see a lot more maps.  The weight of your weapon has impact, and it's satisfying to see your enemies explode.

This game is enjoyable, but has a feeling of 'the same'.  It is a casual game, but it does what it needs to do very well.  I never felt like my time was wasted, or that I wasn't being respected by the game.  If this game looks enjoyable to you, I can easily recommend it.

This is a summary of my review video, which I encourage you to watch
if you are looking for a more in-depth review.

Thanks for your viewership and support; for more videos click here:

http:/www.youtube.com/user/SocioPyscho

author: {'steamid': '76561198018204380', 'num_games_owned': 644, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1426978471}
review:
-May include spoilers but worth it if you are still unsure about the game.
Mixed feelings about this game but here -

At first this game is quite bad, you will probably get frustrated constantly from losing the second or third level. Yes the hitbox is terrible so the only ammo upgrade worth having is the buckshot. Some type of cows are annoying to hit - for example the ones that can't walk straight so even buckshot may miss quite a few times. 

On a normal type game 10 cows may raid your barn [huehuehue] but it only takes one of them to kill you so you'd have to restart quite frequently since you need to stand infront of them to kill them! Besides all of that, the reason I decided to rate it as recommended is: The later levels.

It wasn't particularly fun but I actually enjoyed mass murdering thousands of cows. 
Buckshot + Weapon upgrades (I prefer the reload capacity to be upgraded first because reloading is a pain in the ass (x)) is OP.
You get to fire a machine gun constantly on some levels.
You can call in free perks such as chopper gunners, FIRE! :D, auto-turret, NUKE etc that have short cooldowns (all have the same cooldown timers).
And finally the boss... I'll let you handle that flat piece of ass.

10/10 would cow again.

Es muy divertido, al verlo por primera vez parece simple pero al jugarlo no te cansas de matar vacas zombies y mas con las ayudas que te ofrecen o las mejoras que se le puede poner a la arma, ademas en algunas etapas el modo de juego cambia un poco.
Lo malo es que aveces cuando vas por la parte final de las oleadas el juego se pone lento y que el precio es bastante alto pero de hay es muy recomendado para pasar momentos de sin nada que hacer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985100593', 'num_games_owned': 2106, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1427578405}
review:
The game is better than Radical Roach (by the same dev). That's not saying much though. DO NOT. I repeat DO NOT buy this at any price above 50 cent. You'll find free flash games better than this. The reason you would pay anything above zero is because at the very least it drop trading cards and there is a mild amusement factor thrown in.

Pros:
-Theme. Okay, I like the zombie cows and old farmer as the protagonist.

Cons:
-Hit box. About the worst thing in the game. It is so inconsistent. You can be hitting cows in the head at one moment and in the next watch bullets zip through like ghosts. This is especially evident when old farmer shooting from the barn window as zombie cows dance around. There's been many times when I get hit by a cow just right after a shot just whiz past. Oh yeah, of course it's a one hit kill.
-Reload speed. You are given a reload button but cannot reload as fast as your thumb pressing on the dang thing. If that's by design it's a really poor choice for a shooter that depends on it. As level progress cows come up faster & faster and in greater numbers. When you have to manage between shooting, reload, inventory purchase, and support from above and you come up blank do to reload response isn't there, it's really frustrating. (FYI, I'm using a 360 controller)
-Spawning at the start of level. This is old school cheap method of making a game longer than it really is.
-Repetition. I have to mention this even though it is expected of this type of game. It's the very least of concern (see above).

Shooters require tight controls and mechanics which this game does not have, making it not only challenging but frustrating. I simply cannot recommend it. Only get this is it's a bundle filler or given free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073630672', 'num_games_owned': 858, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1423625670}
review:
Fuck this game. Just to put it plainly. Do not play this game. No matter how much gameplay you watch you will get pissed. I have probably called bull shit on this game at least 23 times. This game is also addictive in the bad way where you want to beat the game just to say you did and because the cows are so annoying.

Pros:
What pros

Cons:
Bad sound quality
Bad Name
Crappy weapons
Frusterating levels
Bad Graphics (even if they weren't aiming for good graphics)

In the words of the Angry Video Game Nerd
"WHAT WERE THEY THINKING!!!"

Personal Value: -$5.00
Final Verdict: 0/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198149212936', 'num_games_owned': 737, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 327, 'last_played': 1423375818}
review:
This game is nuts. Zombie cows, gore, a honey badger, hippies, shotgun shooting gun, and zombie cows man. If for some reason the video they put up on the Steam page isnt enough, try some real time gameplay I recorded:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Yuca6fUXLFo

My only complaints come in for the aiming. It's not perfect and it certainly feels that way when you're trying to align your shots in the path of a enemy. There are shots that miss that I could have sworn would get me a kill. Other than that, the game is so much damn fun. Great 2D shooter that keeps the action coming. Not sure if casual is the term to use for a game like this as it actually gets pretty intense at times.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144121955', 'num_games_owned': 603, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 868, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1452080647}
review:
It is a fun game. Only issue I have is that it is hard to line up a shot. There were plenty of times that I would shoot at a cow, it would miss, but the cow would still impale me. If the cow was in line with me to impale me, then my shot should not have missed.
Maybe add a reticle? Or laser sight? Or just fix this graphically so it makes sense. Something needs to change.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001046455', 'num_games_owned': 13201, 'num_reviews': 349, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1421024230}
review:
TL;DR: Simple fast-paced, albeit short, wave defender. I'd advice to get it on discount.

In Culling of the Cows you slaughter hundreds of cows, a couple of badgers and also some hipsters. All of them are zombies though. There's a reason for that revealed at the end but it's totally ridiculous like the whole idea itself. For whatever reason you don't want the monsters in your barn. You got to go through the farm utterly destroying all the undead bovine life forms with your trusty shotgun and (!) the mudafucking airforces.

Perhaps surprisingly, this is rather fun and enjoyable. Voice acting is horrible though but for that matter the game lasts only couple of hours even if you try to ace everything.

Every level you begin with a shotgun shooting slugs. God promises to sell you better weapons and help along the way because he's a such good guy. He also sends you money to pay for all the stuff. Then you proceed to kill all the enemies rampaging towards you. You got to reload manually so proceed with care and precision. This can be annoying as the hitboxes are quite small. This also makes the spread-out ammo upgrade super useful.

Frankly, you can only shoot forward and you're slow at walking, so sometimes you can't prevent a cow from passing or indeed killing you. This is where assists come in: you can call up airforces, bombings, sentry guns, fire walls, all kinds of overpowered defenses that will mostly take care of your job for you, with brief cooldowns in between. Still it often takes another try to ace any level, especially since that means you can't buy some overpowered weapons.

It wouldn't stay fresh for long but fortunately it's also quite short, the 40 levels taking only some 2-3 hours to ace. However, the short length is also a curse: it's not really worth the full price. However, at a decent discount or in a bundle, go for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117198358', 'num_games_owned': 673, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1426274258}
review:
Not really a complete game as such, but more or less a suprisingly good one that also happens to include some pretty f****d up cows, crazy farmers and horribly voice acted god.

Now I have to admit, the voice acting as stated before is horrible. But I think of it still as quite a humorous game and it adds up to how much I like it. The upgrades aren't really original same as abilities but still has some potential... if the devs decide to carry the game on.

Pros

- Pretty stupid, the story and the overall design.
- Horribly voice acted, which I think is a good thing.
- It's fun, as a 5 minute timewaster and nothing more. Expect this to be played for at most 3 hours and then left in your steam library and with the cobwebs growing...

Cons

- Fairly limited gameplay, gets repetitive.
- Not completely original, the upgrades, the style of side scrolling defense and the overall feel, makes me wish this was free as a flash game.
- Not entirely worth $13 USD, but if you have some money lying around when this is on sale. $3.79 (75% off) is quite the interesting deal.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990763278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1421730941}
review:
What i like about this
1) Easy steam achievement (doable in 2 hours)
2) There's steam cards
3) There's cheat console (not like there's any need to use it, its really easy to clear everystage)

What I dislike about this
1) seems too oldschool
2) You are just an old man defending your farm and u end up going to different area and kill the ufo?
3) Dislike the ending

In summary, do not buy the game at full price.... (or half price) (i got mine for free)

review:
It's a decent game.
The gameplay is nothing special, there is only 1 weapon and it gets very repetitive, very fast.
The hitboxes are pretty bad.
The visuals are okay.
The music track is really short and the loop is noticeable.

Is it worth 11â‚¬? No. Not at all.
Is it a nice enough game to get from a bundle/for free? Sure.

MEH!

I don't understand the game. We as a farmer must protect our base or storage from zombie cows using a shotgun. The shotgun reload is very slow. You will get a bullet for each turn. The shotgun must be upgraded before jumping to next level.

Zombie cows keep coming. A strange game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079419391', 'num_games_owned': 219, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1421281047}
review:
Actually i would not recommend this game even if you can get it for free.
This game is really bad. I regret the 2 hours i spent to clear it, and i'd really like to have them back to stare a wall. Totally no fun, poor graphic, hitboxes totally random, most upgrades are useless, just pick green shells and bigger reload to face anything anywhere anytime. There are a lot of enemies... but you won't notice any difference (maybe funny colored corpses?) as long as you keep shooting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128685342', 'num_games_owned': 248, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1435250948}
review:
Il gioco si presenta con una grafica "grezza", cartunesca. Il gameplay si basa sul diffendere la nostra fattoria da ondate di vacche/tori con il morbo della muca pazza (?), in pochÃ¨ parole Ã¨ un tower defense. Si posso acquistare vari potenziamente grazie al budget trovabile durante la parita (un po' all'inizio, gli altri gli devi trovare nei power-up). Ci sono due modalitÃ  : la prima "classica" dove posso entrare soltato 10 vacche nella nostra fatoria, nella seconda non dobbiamo permettere a nessuna vacca di entrare.
Il gioco si Ã¨ rivelato abbastanza divertente, forse un po' troppo ripetitivo. E 10,99 euro sono tanti, troppi per un gioco di questo genere.

Voto 6.75/10

P.S. Si possono travare le "carte" di steam, per la medaglia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047158566', 'num_games_owned': 1113, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1421226111}
review:
-TERRIBLE HITBOXES
Watch as your bullets pass straight through their legs.

-ABYSMAL IN GAME CHALLENGES
Can you imagine a game where our hero never got any upgrades? Imagine how boring megaman would've been if you never got a single upgrade. Some might disagree, but IMO why can't you have challenges that let you utilize the game's mechanics/upgrades. It's why time attack is such a popular challenge; Not "beat the level without using X"

-UI
No tooltip info when you click/hover over an available assist, upgrade, or enemy within a given level. That goes for in battle and on the world map.

-NO STORY ARCH
the game trailer does a better job of telling a story

-only 5 achievements
Great for people looking to add a perfect game to their steam collection. But from a consumer standpoint, it lowers overall replayability

review:
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Spiel: 

Ein klassisches Tower Defense spiel wie Plants vs Zombies, nur das hier meistens nur KÃ¼he erschossen werden.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Einzelspieler:

Man ballert als alter Farmer mutierte KÃ¼he von der Farm die gerne in die Scheune wÃ¼rden. Man muss immer eine Anzahl an Wellen Ã¼berstehen um in das nÃ¤chste Level zu kommen.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Grafik:

Die Grafik ist ok, nicht weltbewegend aber reicht vollkommen aus.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Musik:

Die Musik ist gut und passend zum Spiel, aber dennoch nicht hitverdÃ¤chtig.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Steuerung:

Funktioniert sehr gut mit XBOX360 Pad. 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Pro/Contra:

- wie Plants vs. Zombie nur mit KÃ¼hen
- wird schnell eintÃ¶nig 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Fazit:

Ich bin keine Fan von Tower Defense spielen, daher fand ichs auch recht schnell sehr langweilig. FÃ¼r Leute die aber PvsZ gut finden denke ich ist das mal was anderes, aber fÃ¼r den Preis dennoch nicht zu empfehlen.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Zusammengefasst: 

Einzelspieler: 4/10
Grafik: 5/10
Musik: 4/10
Steuerung: 7/10
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Spiel: 5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198109064566', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1419302052}
review:
This should have been on miniclips in my opinion... The game is a wave based cow shooter. I can find little to nothing to agree with this game. If you need something to hold you over between downloads, this has short bust fun, but its not worth paying for.

5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197991750529', 'num_games_owned': 641, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1420567536}
review:
This is a typical wave based 2D shoot em up. It has a funny little gimmic which is basically a nazi ufo turns the cows into zombies. So it's not that serious. 

[h1] Graphics: [/h1] 
The art style is okay, nothing special. Looks like a flash game.

[h1] Sound: [/h1] 
The enemies have good sounds (except that annoying crow) just like the weapons. I think the voice over work is rly cheesy sometimes it works sometimes it doesn't. The music is repetitive as hell you won't stand it longer than like 2,3 levels. The problem is basically there is a 30 sec loop and nothing else except for the menu music. 

[h1] Gameplay: [/h1] 
You have to shoot down cows and other enemies in front of you. There are many types of enemies like super fast cow, 
tank cow, a crazy cow that comes at you in a crisscross and many more. So the enemy variety is good. But the algorithm is easy: Is this guy ahead of the others? -> shoot OR is this guy faster than the others? -> shoot that first.
There are game modes like simple turret sectons, boss fights, 1 big wave, normal wave. You can upgrade your shotgun in the previous 2. There are ammo types like birdshot, buckshot, slug... each is different but I think the buckshot is your bread and butter because it shoots in a cone. And the awkward hit detection (or the sense of position I'm not sure) is really annoying and it puts you out of the mood. You can also upgrade your ammo capacity, reload speed, fire rate, and you can attach a laser pointer on your shotgun. These upgrades can be obtained by your starter and drop money. You can also call for a care packege which contains money or powerups like unlimited ammo, unlimited health, slomo... for a limited time. But I walked through them almost every time because of the awkward sense of position.
You can also call aids like air strike, napalm barrels, nuke and other over the top stuff. 
The game gets really repetitive after 30-60 minutes. There is only one level type (The Farm) but it indicates like there will be other themes but no... just the farm. 

[h1] Replayability: [/h1] 
There are achievements per stage but you mustn't use the upgrade system or the aid system to earn these which defeats the only good thing in the game.

[h1] Overall: [/h1] 
[b] Pros: [/b] 
[list]
 [*]Setting
 [*]Nice upgrade system and air support bonuses
 [*]Gore
 [*]Trading Cards
 [*]Casual fun time for a few hours
 [/list]
[b] Cons: [/b] 
 [*]Only 1 weapon (except for the turret segments)
 [*]Annoying hit detection and sense of position
 [*]Music is bad and repetitive
 [*]Lack of variety in levels
 [*]Questionable game design
 [*]The Extras menu leads you to nowhere...
 [*]HIgh price!
[/list]

[h1] Verdict: [/h1] 
It's not worth 11 euros for sure. If you want some mindless fun for a few hours then buy it on a sale. I had some fun but I had many many frustrated moments as well. It's an average game at best. Won't kill you but won't save you. 
My recomendation is neutral but the actual price lowers it a little bit. Oh and if you want to play it the "fun" way it lasts 2 hours.
